description:
OMG me and my friend visit ENO while we search on Yelp. They serve variety version of wine and cheese

When I ask the server to recommend some wine they find awesome wine for you 

Even the cheese and chocolate was amazing you should try their brie cheese and chocolate from Madagascar
 Those are an amazing and nice mood for date and have a girls night :)
author: Elaine L.

description:
This place is a nice space.   I came here during the Dreamforce conference and our Salesforce sales person held an event for his customers.   It had some really good wine choices and food choices.   

It has a lot of seating both in the back and front.   I would definitely recommend if we are in this area for wine and bites.
author: Homer S.

description:
ENO is a great wine bar in the heart to Union Square! It's modern, charming, somewhat intimate and moderately priced.

I took a date to ENO last week and we were seated next to the window by a charming server who was happy to answer questions about the menu. He provided us both with a taste of his favorite wine on the menu and gave recommendations for others that may be more up our alley -- we ended up ordering a glass of Zinfandel and a red blend. 

Food-wise, we both ordered the prosciutto, pesto and arugula sandwich. I thought it was delicious, and judging off my date's empty plate, it's safe to say he did too.
author: Bryan D.

description:
I always walk past this place when I'm on my way home, and given its proximity to Union Square, I always figured it was a bit of a tourist trap but admired the nice seating space near the window. Last week, I finally got the chance to try it out, and I would say my initial assumptions were mostly correct. 

There's a long list of wine flights, from whites to reds to sparkling. There's definitely a lot to choose from, and the typical flight is ~$20. Since my friend and I were starving, we ordered the flight and decided to splurge on the Eno Experience, Baked Brie, and Coppa Flatbread. 

The wine was okay but I didn't really have any favorites in the flight I chose (a New Zealand flight of two reds and a white). Usually, I have at least one favorite. The food is pretty expensive. For the ENO Experience, you get a couple small cheeses, some slices of salami, and ONE chocolate. How are you supposed to share just one chocolate?? At least give two.. 

The baked brie was not as runny as it should've been, and the flavor of the brie and jam were too subtle. There definitely could have been more fruitiness in this dish. The flatbread was probably the best part of the meal, but even that could've used some more flavor. This place is nice to people watch and have a nice conversation, but the quality of the bites could use some work.
author: Sophie W.

description:
Love ENO. If you love wine this is great place to go. Wine, cheese, chocolate, what's more to ask??? 
The environment is really relaxing and always comfortable. Their service is usually great and the servers are very knowledgeable about the different wines. This past time I went the service wasn't so great but I can't judge them based on one bad experience and a bunch of great ones. Server may have been having a bad day but basically wasn't friendly and really non attentive. Nevertheless I will always come here. I enjoy trying out new wine flights then picking my favorite to sip on, you can never have too much wine! Definitely a great place to take friends. A Little gem! Love going here and I can't wait to be back.
author: Noor A.

description: Probably my new favorite wine bar. They have delicious wine flights that are sure to satisfy, whether you like reds or whites. Their selection of rosés and bubblies is also impressive. This place definitely knows wine and is dang good at it. The staff is super knowledgeable, kind, and attentive. The decor and atmosphere make the place feel so cozy. I can't wait for my next visit after the next payday!
author: Toshi P.

description:
Lovely, charming & wild wine list wine bar in the heart of Union Square. It's literally beneath the Westin St. Francis hotel, on Geary street. 

They offer charcuterie and cheese plates, small bites, and open late.

Their wine list will throw you off a bit if you are only familiar with Napa/Sonoma wines or main stream old world. Expect the unexpected, they offer new and old world but some that even us as wine collectors and in the business, have never heard of.

So if you are a wild child and adventurous like me, go wild here, you will be in for a treat.

We will be back!
author: Manda Bear B.

description: This is a wonderful, cozy and very friendly place to enjoy great wines paired with menu items designed to compliment their selections. The service is excellent and so is the ambiance. Lastly, there is a very enjoyable book about wines nearby each table and I found this to be a very nice touch and quite interesting. I highly recommend visiting Eno when in San Francisco!
author: Dave B.

description: ENO is a true gem. The staff is amazingly knowledgeable, and I wish I knew the name of the person who helped us with our drink choices. We don't know much about wine, so the in depth explanations and even description of process of making some of the different types of wines was super helpful. I also appreciated the little cards they give you with more details about origin, flavor notes, and overall profile of the wine flights. The charcuterie board we got was a delicious addition as well. If I lived closer that would be a solid go to spot.
author: Michelle S.

description: The food is pretty good. They have a wide menu of different things. The place was packed and the waitress did a great job keeping on top of our order and what we wanted. We sat in the back and the music wasn't too loud but it was in other places. They seem to have a lot of spaces for big parties. We would go again if we were visiting.
author: Desa D.

description:
*Updated review: From 4-stars to 5-stars!!
I've been here so many times and can't express enough about how pleasant it is here! Service is top-notch and I love the bubbles.

An absolutely amazing spot to chill and catch up with friends. The waiters were so attentive, kind, and helpful. My friends and I always come back to this place to grab drinks because the atmosphere is soothing and peaceful.

Food/drink recommendations:
*Wine and champagne!! It's a wine bar, so definitely try out their wide selections.
*Bruschetta flight (a trio): Probably the best bruschetta I've ever had!
*Deviled eggs (minced with apple curry): Yummy. I rarely get deviled eggs at restaurants, so ordering this was such a treat.
*The Reserve flight: a variety of cheeses, fruits, goods, etc.
*Pesto flatbreads: Nailed it on the flavors, but the bread itself was just okay.

Would come back :)
author: Jenny H.

description:
What a great little spot!  Warm...inviting...friendly...and chill.  We were wandering around Union Square and stopped into the St. Francis to look at their Christmas displays.  They always do a great job. 

She:  Well, what next?
Me:  There's a wine bar close by somewhere...we tried to go last time..

We had a nice little table right in the center.  Eno reminds me of places in NYC...very cozy.  We were offered to sit on the sofa area but I felt I'd probably be so comfortable, I'd fall asleep.  I ordered the featured red flight and the dark chocolate truffles.  Yolie had a glass of prosecco.

The music was really good and the service was wonderful.  At one point, Yolie asked how I was feeling and the word "content" was the first that came to mind.  Such a great way to end the evening.  I think this is a great place to come to after work, or before or after dinner.  I can't wait to come back!
author: Mikey H.

description:
Came here today with a friend after work. I had always been eying our ENO, and finally got my chance to try it out today...and I'm glad I did! Located in the heart of Union Square, this place is easy to get to by bus or Bart. If I could describe ENO in 3 words, I'd describe it as cozy, romantic, and chic. The interior is invitingly modern, with just the perfect amount of light for the perfect date night or hang out spot. I'd say that ENO exudes the Danish concept of "hygge" (coziness).

My friend and I both shared the portobello flat bread, charcuterie platter, and one of the chocolate plates. Portions are kind of small, but enough to fill you if you have a small appetite. It was enough for my friend and me since we weren't the hungriest. Plus we were enjoying our food and wine, so we got fuller faster since we were eating slowly. We both did a wine flight each. I did the End of the World wine flight-- I wanted to sample some red wines from the more isolated, remote area of the world. The three wines were from Humboldt, Patagonia and Margaret River. At first, I felt that the wines didn't have much character, but as I continued sipping and airing them, their flavors came out more boldly. They paired well with the charcuterie plate, so I'd recommend this wine flight with it! 

The service here is friendly and attentive. We were looked after graciously, asked the wines/food were, and were refilled with water throughout our dining experience. 

I'd like to come back here to sample some more wines! Hope to come again soon!
author: Matthew L.

description: My friends and I had such a wonderful time at this place. Our server was something right out of a classic European movie. We had appetizers and tasted a variety of wines. The atmosphere was amazing. The food was just the right amount and complimented everything we were drinking. Perfect place to chill with a group. Be warned- a bit small. So get there early.
author: Janet P.

description:
Amazing location. A block from union square. I started with the featured flight and a taster plate. 2 cheeses( one hard, one soft) bread, olives, greens, some meat and the BEST part- the pickled grapes. Delicious! So good I had to ask for the recipe. The atmosphere offers a great people watching spot. Cozy, warm lighting, and great street views. 
The service was amazing. She was able to help me choose a wine flight, timely and very knowledgeable. 
Bathroom was super clean, which is a great sign. I will be back with friends next time for sure.
author: Amanda M.

description:
Good wine and knowledgeable staff. Had a charcuterie plate and it was good though the bread was stale and once it cooled you could really tell. I told the waiter and he said he'd "look into it" but he never came back and offered a replacement. 
Nice place with a mercifully-low drunk loud girls quotient. Wish they were as enthusiastic about service as they are about the wine.
author: Josh S.

description: Great wine bar with a huge selection of vino. The ambiance is wonderful and having the option to do the sampling flights was great. A little pricey, but to be expected in downtown San Francisco.
author: Mark R.

description:
Came here with a couple friends to hang out on a Saturday afternoon. The ambiance was nice - almost all the tables were taken, but it didn't feel crowded at all. This was a great place to bond over our appreciation for wine. Each flight of wine was accompanied with a little history lesson from the server.

My bf and I shared a white wine flight called Jurassic Park. It was called this in reference to the soil that the grapes in the wine were grown in, which gave them all minerally flavors. This was a great experience, and I would come again to try other flights on a lazy afternoon.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Came here around happy hour time as a break from a scavenger hunt my then boyfriend was planning for me. I was stuck on a clue and couldn't for the life of me figure it out. Staff were super friendly and helped me figure it out!

Thanks to them, I found out the last clue in my then boyfriend's scavenger hunt and was proposed to shortly thereafter!!

Thank you to Nicole and the rest of the staff there that afternoon for helping me out! Can't wait to come back and celebrate!

As for food and wine pairings, this place is phenomenal. Staff are really knowledgeable about their wines and their meat and cheese platters are perfect for an afternoon snack!
author: Michelle C.

description:
Menu items are off the charts darlin! Came in solo on a weekday around 3pm trying to stumble-upon on some affordable Happy Hour Deals, but came to find they didn't offer any. Trying to make my visit worth while, I decided to opt with a half glass and prosciutto flatbread. It turns out I actually ordered a $18 full glass.. Prosciutto flatbread was sub-par, a little burnt on the edges, but was definitely filling. 

This place is great for tourists or those visiting the city. I can say this place is great for an intimate date or a small business meeting. I personally don't think it's quite suitable for groups - you may have to rent it out or make a reservation. It's safe to say I won't come back any time soon, but I do hope they bring their HH deals back.
author: Jana V.

description: Great place for vino and snacks after a day of shopping in union square. Also a great date spot.
author: Chris B.

description: Worst spot ever!!! They said they are open till midnight but have tired to go there two nights In a row  aT about 10/10:30 but they are already closed! If you plan to close early you should be consistent with Yelp, Facebook, website etc. don't make the customer feel bad for showing up when you no longer want to work especially when you said you would be open!!!
author: Jodi W.

description: My mom and I were looking for a wine bar that wasn't too crowded or too expensive near union square. This is definitely the place! The staff was super friendly and helped guide us through the menu. We each got a flight, shared the cheese and charcuterie, and got a glass of our favorites from the flight. I will be coming back to this spot! It has an indoor fireplace and romantic lighting, if youre looking for a chill getaway from the craziness of union square.
author: Mollie H.

description: One of my favorite wine bars in the Bay Area. Warm, relaxed atmosphere and friendly, personable service - not what I'd expect from a wine bar in the heart of Union Square. I like the offering of unusual, unique wines and various kinds of flights (bubbly, rose, white, reds, and more). There's even a deviled egg flight! The truffle dessert is also great as well as the dark chocolate "flight." I'll be going back to try more light bites next time!
author: Edwina D.

description:
Eno wine bar is a lovely and relaxing escape from the hustle and bustle of Union Square.

I came here after work recently to sip rose and catch up with a friend, but it would also be perfect for a date night. Maybe not a first date though, cause it easily adds up after a delicious cheese plate or two.

We went for the The Reserve Flight of cheeses and the Truffled Sheep Pecorino was my favorite. Paired with the rose pinot, it was fantastic. They also have chocolate flights of truffles, flatbreads, and other assorted food options. 

The service is great and the setting is warm and inviting. It's easy to spend an evening here.
author: Shira W.

description: Can't believe that I found this gem only now!! Despite being in hectic, touristy union square, the ambiance is very chill and not crowded. the staff is very friendly and welcoming, and very passionate about wine (one of them even wrote a book on wine!!). Their bubbles flight was AMAZING- highly recommend! We stumbled onto this lovely bar only because the commercialized vibes and unfriendly service from the Press Room (another wine bar 5 mins away) spurned us in search of another wine bar in the union square vicinity, and I am so glad to have found this!! Definitely will come back again and bring more friends with me along next time!
author: Yoon P.

description:
Passed by this place with the mister and our toddler. "Oh, I want to go there!" But obviously couldn't with the kid. 

But alas, a last minute babysitter was my Golden ticket in! What a great escape: chill environment, sit wherever you want, stay at long as you want.

I noticed that there was only one guy serving the place on a Friday night, but he didn't seem to be phased, and still was able to take the time to explain all wine and pairings with just the right amount of detail.

Everything came out promptly and was delicious. Was particularly impressed with the generous amount of cheese, we ran out of wine before the cheese!
author: Eileen M.

description: It's a busy and nice wine bar in town. Different wine flights on the menu and some small plate food options. The wines by the glass is also decent and the service is good. I just stopped for a couple of glasses of wine and whilst a tad expensive it was nice wines. All in all a good experience.
author: Sam S.

description:
This place is awesome. It's really intimate and quiet, which is perfect for a romantic date. My boyfriend and I ordered the Eno Experience with a Boujie, Beaugy Flight and a chocolate flight that was perfectly paired with wine. Everything was yummy. I really like the Chardonnay, it went down pretty easy and it was sweet. I also like the Eno Experience, they give you a good amount of everything. The chocolate flight with the wine was good. I really enjoyed the dark chocolate with the red wine. 
Also, this place is a little expensive. It may seem overpriced, but they care about quality over quantity of their food and wine. Lastly, I would say that this place is awesome and everyone should go to a wine bar at least once in their life.
author: Nuchee V.

description: We went after dinner to meet friends for some drinks. The waitress was rude and gave us an attitude because one person did not want to order any wine but rather just wanted water. Her attitude was appalling.
author: Yogeeta N.

description: Nice selection of wines and apps right off of Union Square.  You would never know you're in the middle if a heavily touristed area.  Good service lively place for a happy hour.
author: Becky M.

description: AMAZING!!! This place is a dream come true!!! I went with some friends the other night and I was sooo happy to have vegan cheese and wine options....... it gets even better...... the cheese is from the Uncreamery, my favorite local vegan cheese. It was nice to unwind after work and enjoy good food and good company! Next time I am trying the vegan grilled cheese sandwich with my fave, ghost pepper jack!
author: Erica S.

description: This place is so cute to go after work with a small group. I went with one of my girlfriends on a weekday. We shared a SALAD, CHEESE BOARD, and a FLAT BREAD with some wine. It was totally perfect, and just the right amount of food, in the best setting. I'm definitely coming back next time i'm in SF. ENJOY!
author: Darlene Y.

description: So much fun. Everyone was really nice and the food was yummy. Been back multiple times after this review.
author: Ivan M.

description:
Disclaimer: I know very little about wine and I'm actually not much of a wine drinker. 

I greatly enjoyed ENO! We stopped in somewhat on a whim on the recommendation of a friend who had been there before. 

There are light appetizers you can order to go along with your wine. As far as the wine goes, there seems to be an really great selection. I thought the wine flights were super cool and each person in our group agreed - wine flights all around! 

Our waiter completely impressed me with his knowledge and presentation of each of our wine flights. His passion was palpable and actually piqued my interest in the wines we were all drinking. 

The atmosphere here is dark and cozy and cool... I was here with colleagues and loved it but it would also be perfect for date night.
author: Megan L.

description:
It was my girlfriend's birthday and she wanted to grab a drink. We were in Union Square shopping and decided to check out Eno Wine Bar. We both walked in on Thursday, December 15th around 6:30pm. There were a few open tables, so we grabbed a two top in the back of the front section of the bar.

*Kickin' Acid ($19): '14 Royal Tokaj "Oddity" Dry Furmint, Hungary; '15 Sabathi Sauvignon Blanc, Styria, Australia; '15 Matthiasson Chardonnay, Napa Valley, CA
*The Decade Club ($25): '05 La Rioja Alta "Vina Ardanza" Tempranillo, Rioja, ES; '05 il Fauno, Super Tuscan Style Blend, IT; '05 Pietra Santa "Vache" Cabernet Blend, Cienaga, CA
*2015 Matthiasson Linda Vista Chardonnay, Napa Valley, CA ($15 glass) ×2
*2012 Freemark Abbey, Cabernet Sauvignon, Knight's Valley, Sonoma County ($22 glass)
*Romesco-Duck Flatbread: roasted bell peppers, manchego cheese, arugula ($12)

We both started with a flight. I'm a red girl and I love big, bold wines, so the waiter suggested I try the Decade Club flight. This was perfect for me. The pours were pretty good and priced decently as well. With our flights, we decided to try the duck flatbread. It came out nice and hot. The duck and cheese melded into a good comforting bite. I also liked the addition of the arugula. Added a nice fresh peppery-ness to the pizza. After our flights, we both had glasses. The Freemark Abbey Cab was a good follow up to my flight. My gf enjoyed the whites she had. Her fav was the last glass in the flight, so she ordered two more glasses afterwards.

Who knew such a cute wine bar existed in Union Square? I normally try to avoid bars in this area as they can be a little touristy, but this was a nice find!
author: Elena N.

description: Great service and descriptions of each glass of wine. Gives off the illusion that you are somewhere other than union square. Not super touristy despite the location.
author: Sarah P.

description:
As much as I like that fancy feeling you get when holding that delicate wine stem, and gingerly sipping on an Argentinian wine I am less of a wine-bar kinda girl than I am a beer bar kinda girl.  I like wine - I really do, but I'd rather be hunched over a beer with a craft beer any day.  Regardless, the wine bar was an experience that I wouldn't have passed up.  Had I the energy, I'd likely have gone to some other wine bars in the city, but as this was the closest one to my hotel, my fiancé and I decided to wander in here.  We actually tried to come to ENO once before our dine-in, but were unable to enter due to there supposedly being a "private event" going on...funny, I didn't see anyone except the workers in the shop during this so-called event.

On the second time that we tried to come to ENO we were allowed in, and sat by the window on a nice spring night.  Upon walking through the wine bar I admired the tranquil, laid-back feel it was attempting to encompass, but I couldn't help but feel out of place.  No matter, that is more of a personal opinion - what truly matters is that the lovely lady serving us was extremely kind and helpful in offering wine pairing suggestions.  There's a descent variety of wine offerings, though I would have almost expected more.  With that being said, there were plenty of wines found on this list that I have not found elsewhere.  While I enjoyed a delectable Argentinian wine, my fiancé indulged in a red wine from New Zealand.  Both were very robust, yet drinkable, though I think that is the general line for all their wines here at ENO.  My complaint is with the price; there's simply not much to say other than ENO is a little over-priced.

The same story goes for the food, which mostly consists of cheese and charcuterie boards along with chocolate and other finger food.  To me, it seemed as if they had simply thrown together some cheese and meat, knowing that people would consume it while drinking wine, instead of deliberately choosing and pairing legitimately good cheese, meats and crackers.  To put it simply, I was underwhelmed by ENO.  I did not hate the food, but I've had better.  The wine was definitely good, but I would prefer to drink my wine at home and my beer when I'm out on the town.  Now, just a note - if you want to enjoy the food with your wine, make sure you get there by 10pm (I think) because that is when they stop serving the food.  

ENO is in a very convenient location, and therefore attracts more tourists (myself included), but I would actually make an effort to travel further out of your way to some of the other wine bars that exist in San Francisco.  This is a fine business, but it's not my favorite.  Sorry, I've still not converted to a wine bar fanatic at this point.
author: Lauren K.

description:
Chocolate + dessert wine pairing = MAGICAL DAY IN UNION SQUARE!!!

Yes, I've heard of ENO wine bar at other posh locations.  I like this one around the corner from The Westin.  I usually find tranquility around the holidays inside St. Francis at Chateau Montelena's tasting room.  Go down the side steps of the hotel and voila, you're transported to another world!  ENO wine bar provides the ambiance of elegance, casual fun, and relaxed California lifestyle.  It's perfect for travelers, locals, and those who need an afternoon of peace amongst the Union Square madness.  ENO is also open late for those who want to kick it after a show. 

Yes, it's a chain, but who cares?  I'm tired of seeing another clothing store; ENO has been such a great addition to Union Square.  I hope there are more wine bars along Geary.  ENO showcases local merchants, wines, cheeses, and chocolates.  My friends and I came right at noon shortly after our dim sum gathering at Hong Kong Lounge II.  I probably scared Joel who was trying to open up shop, while I'm pulling on the door handles like the old Mervyn's commercial "open, open, open"!  

Our flight of dessert wines...AMAZING and the chocolates...SUPERB!  Thank you Joel for being awesome!  I will be back in no time and wait after high noon LOL =) 

'Til we meet again ~ cheers!!!
author: Christine R.

description:
This wine bar is located right next to Union Square, so close to all the busy shoppers, but once you get inside, you feel like you're in a totally different place. Inside is very classy, with a wall lined with wines, small tables and lounge spots, immaculate bathrooms, and knowledgable staff. We were in search of wine and food in the late afternoon, when it was not busy yet. There were still a few small groups that had arrived and were comfortably seated with wine already in hand. It was a very cozy scene. It seems like it would still seem cozy when it gets full because there was still plenty of floor space.

We ordered the brie and chocolate plate along with wine flights. The food was on the pricey side, but tasty. It's a typical tapas sized plate. It's for taste, not to be filling, so if you're hungry you have to eat first. The wine flights were a nice size. The staff explained the tasting properties of each wine and they came with little information cards. That was a wonderful touch! And the wines did taste very unique! The wine experience was delightful.
author: Katie D.

description:
Wine flights and date nights.

Pros:
+ Prime location to hop around
+ Intimate and quiet
+ Wine flights with cards to learn about them
+ I want to say extensive list of wines, but my memory is a bit fuzzy

Cons:
- None

Recommendations:
+ Flight of white wine (there's only one I believe)

I came in on an empty stomach. Wrong move. I thought the charcuterie would do the trick, but I clearly needed more food than thin slices of meat and little pieces of bread. Had my first taste of Merlot, which turned out great. Great way to try out and learn about wines. The informational cards help. We both had two flights of wine and shared the charcuterie, totaling out to $100 with tip, not too shabby.

You know you had a good time when all your pictures on your iPhone look like crap. I'll be back!
author: Fanny W.

description:
Loved it, loved it, loved it! My friend suggested we meet here because of its proximity to Union Square, but also because of it's ambiance. She chose well - from the moment I stepped into Eno, I relaxed and enjoyed myself. We had a cute (small) table by the window, with a nice view of people bustling by.

Our waitress was very nice and super knowledgeable. She gave us more than enough time to be indecisive, but answered every question thoroughly. I picked the champagne flight and a flatbread. I had no idea I was picking so well!

First off, the bubbles. The flight was not the same as in the menu, but I don't care because it was awesome. Every single glass was delicious, although my favorite was the Kreinbacher Furmint Brut. Or maybe it was the Iron Horse Rainbow Brut! All were great.

On top of that, my flatbread was delicious. Coppa (salami), caramelized onions, and Gouda. Whoa!! Perfect. I will probably dream of this meal when I'm home, far from SF. Maybe I can make it back before I leave...
author: Deb G.

description:
Stopped in here after some shopping last weekend. We wanted to grab a drink before dinner and we strolled in at about 4:30 PM on a Friday. It was fairly quiet with only a few tables occupied. Our host greeted us and led us to a table by the fireplace. 

We sat around for about 10 minutes wondering if someone was going to bring us menus or give us water. After some irritation, I walked up to the bar and asked for menus and brought them back to our table. 

They have a vast selection of wines which pleasantly surprised me, and ultimately was the saving grace in this case. 

My mom decided to go with a featured wine flight and I opted for the bubbly flight. 

After having to approach the bar in search of service once, we figured they'd get the hint and be more attentive to us - but no. This time my mom headed up to the bar, where servers were hanging out, and proceeded to give them our order. 

Our flights were delicious and the pours are generous. I loved the champagne on my flight so much, I wanted to purchase a bottle there, but couldn't stomach paying $60 for champagne with them after service was lacking so much. I did a quick search online and was able to find the bottle for $20 cheaper online- score!

Overall, I definitely loved their selections and the variety of wines they have available. If the wine selection wasn't that good, my rating would be much lower.  Service could be improved tremendously though, and I hope it does. I may back if in the area for a flight, and hope to encounter better customer service.
author: Lainey L.

description: The food was absolutely incredible and lived up to all of the high standards we had from reading others reviews and scrolling through photos.
author: Virginia G.

description: Staying in San Fran for the weekend and just stopped by. Quite the wine list! Had a beautiful 2016 Richmond Plains Sauvignon Blanc from Nelson, New Zealand. Deliciously paired with the ENO experience taster. A delightful experience and will return on my next visit.
author: Kimberly M.

description: Love this place!  Interesting and quality flights of wine and cheese!  We found this place by accident when we were trying to escape a rare heat wave in San Francisco. Can't wait to go back!
author: dee z.

description: As a local, I find this to be an overpriced wine bar. The atmosphere is great, but the wine pour for a $15 glass was less than generous. I am very knowledgeable about the area and frequent many wine bars, but while a cozy and friendly place, there are better values to be found close by.
author: Sheila K.

description:
Thank you. Thank you for being an island oasis in a city of fun crazy. We sat. We looked at the fireplace. We drank an amazing wine flight. 

We have excellent service from Greg and never felt rushed or pressure to leave, order more or do anything other than enjoy Eno. 

It was the perfect late afternoon wine break after shopping and cable car riding. Until our next unexpected trip to San Fran. 

Thank you. And thank you Yelp for helping me find this place.
author: Chloe E.

description:
Went in an enjoyed a red flight with some olives.

I was the only patron in the place (it was still early).

The place is quaint, inviting and the wine selection is awesome. 

I'm a fan.
author: Dee R.

description:
Cozy wine bar in Union Square, can't get any better than that!

Loved and appreciated the information cards that each flight came with. The cards explained more about each wine with the history and origin of each glass, so thumbs up for Eno for vino amateurs like me.

I only took off a star because of noise and nats flying around everywhere. It was a bit of a turnoff, having to sway off all the nats every few seconds and the place getting a tad bit too loud for my taste.

Other than that, kudos to Eno!
author: Bin H.

description:
Eno.ugh already. This place is just...

...uhhmazing. 

While in the city one fine Saturday afternoon, I found myself in busy Union Square and needed a spot to park it before I headed back down to the Motherland that is SJ. 

Eno was it.

It's an establishment you'd easily pass up unless you kept your eyes peeled and specs on lock while you walk along the city sidewalk. Once you see it, be sure to pop in. Their wine selection is like the size of a phone book (sort of, not really) but there's lots to choose from that you can mix and match your wines, do a flight while pairing it with some cheese, charcuterie or chocolate.

Eno is perfect for catching up with loved ones or getting to know the ones you think you love. I'm definitely going to be checking in here again soon.
author: Cat V.

description:
We discovered Eno last time we were in SF and made it a definite stop this time around. My wife and I ordered two different flights in order to maximize our experience. The staff will discuss your choices and recommend something else, based upon your taste. Our son, an avowed craft beer drinker even ordered a flight (of course, dad was paying!) and enjoyed as well.

In addition to the classic ambiance in the establishment do yourself a favor and sit by one of the windows and watch SF pass before your eyes. People watching at its best. For something so close to Union Square it appears to have avoided the usual crush of tourists. Of course, my wife and I are tourists as well but have visited SF many times over the years and feel quite at home.

Make sure this is on your bucket list of places to enjoy the city and relax a little while enjoying some wonderful wines.
author: Dave W.

description: Awesome selection of wine! Flights are the way to go when you first start off. Decent 3 glass portions for around $20, not a bad price for the city! The lighting is a little dark, but overall awesome vibe. Attentive service and music is at a good level.
author: Kristen S.

description:
Good news: no wine go wasted here. Bad news: mouth full of sediments. Currently playing: servers complaining about their life's. 

Nope nope nope.
author: Fiona P.

description: Thank you Yelp for guiding me towards Eno! Now I'm going to look forward heading up to the city to come here more often! Eno is now my favorite wine bar after The Press Club. Excellent customer service, warm ambiance, and totally cozy for an intimate date night with your significant other or a casual outing with friends. A lot of selections of great wine & sparkling. I'm sure everyone can find something based on their preference.
author: Hang H.

description: Found this place on yelp so i gave them a try.  I was extremely disappointed with their service! As we sat down, i explained to our waiter that i would be the only person who would be drinking wine. He gave us the meanest look then he says, " why didnt you tell me before you sat down!" I was speechless and shocked and confused! How rude he was! I explained to him that my friends didnt want to drink any wine tonight but just wanted to eat some of the food and hang out with me. After explaining to him , i felt so uncomfortable.  I just wanted to leave but i already ordered my food so i just kept calm  and took a deep breath! I would never return to this place,  there are plenty of wine bar all along that street that treat their customers with respect!
author: Gina F.

description: If you want to relax with few friends or your partner/date for some wine and maybe cheese and/or chocolates then ENO is a good place. It has an intimate setting but its right opposite the bus stop, so if you get a window seating be ready to see a lot interesting people outside including homeless people. I wish they had a better wine flights for people who have a palate for sweeter wines.
author: Marmarin V.

description: Nice atmosphere and nice staff.  House flights are 'meh', but the descriptions are hilarious.  The location is coveted. This would be five star with a better core selection of wines.
author: Tim C.

description:
Who knew that there was a place where you can get away from all the madness outside that is San Francisco's Union Square and it's right on the first floor of the legendary Westin St. Francis Hotel? Well Eno Wine Bar might just be the perfect place to calm yourself and get away from it all, whether it be with a friend to converse, a intimate escape with a loved one or a place to cool off on your own. Eno Wine Bar has that smooth and sophisticated atmosphere of a wine bar in the city and then some with its two dimly lit intimate rooms, one that has a sofa and fireplace and the other a little more restaurant-like with a collage of wine bottles decorating the walls. I had never heard of Eno before, and obviously never knew it was a franchise in quite a number of posh venues around the country, so to get to try this place on a weekend afternoon was a real treat.

I was out with friends who were looking to avoid all the shopping madness when we arrived at Union Square on a Saturday afternoon and my friend suggested we try this place out because she had only walked by before and realized this location was no longer the clothing store it once was and she always wanted to try it out. Thankfully we got there at noon on Saturday and it was just in time to see them open for business. I was game but also it was early and I didn't want to get too tipsy and I wasn't very hungry. She suggested we go for a chocolate and wine pairing tasting and our server Joel happily obliged us. Meanwhile a friend who accompanied us was really not into drinking at all so he went with a bottle with the non-alcoholic Lurisia Sparkling Chinotto Orange Citrus ($5).

The normal Port and Chocolate Pairing they serve at Eno Wine Bar ($39) normally contains three different types of Port (LBV, Tawny and Vintage) served alongside three of their truffles (Champagne, Caramel & Sea Salt and Dark Chocolate Madagascar). This time my friend really wanted to try a sweet wine like Moscato. So Joel accommodated us with Moscato, a Madeira from off the coast of Africa, and a 10 year old Tawny Port served with Salted Caramel and Almond Butter Chocolates made by NeoCocoa and a Madagascar Dark Chocolate made by Recchiuti Chocolates. Everything from the presentation of the chocolate served on a plate with a heavy dusting, which included the Eno name spelled out in big bold letters, to the flavors of the Ports and the wines were truly exceptional. I just wish there was more chocolate and wine to consume that afternoon. Eno represented a great place to unwind as if it were a local watering hole to meet your friends after a busy day. Sure it's a bit pretentious and a smidge overstuffed, but that's what living in the big city is all about and with Eno now firmly planted in San Francisco there is no better place to wind down.
author: Jason F.

description:
Going here recently I can now see why there are so many good reviews! Loved the ambiance and the whole vibe of the place! It's kind of like a hole in the wall but more like a mini Napa on the street. Entering the place my friend and I felt a little underdressed but the waiters all were friendly and nice not judging us at all with our casual attire. Although i have never been carded twice before but I guess it's just standard since my friend and I look so young. It was a rainy day and wine was just a nice pair to the mood so my friend and I thought of coming here to have a catch up date. 

For the wine: definitely go straight to the wine flights if you don't know what wine you absolutely love. I find their wine flights names so cute and punny. In the end my friend really likes white wine so we shared an alpine white wine flight. The waitress was so nice with explaining what each wine was and not judging us for our naive knowledge of wine. We loved two of the wines that came with the flight which was the far left and right. The middle wine was a bit too earthy for us, reminded me of a distinct smell you smell in a garden. 

For the food: we just ordered a starter of bread that comes with olive oil and a few pieces of grapes. The bread went well with the wine. 

Overall: will definitely come again!!! Maybe with friends or with my boyfriend. This place really has a romantic and cozy vibe to it.

PS. Love their music.
author: Leslie F.

description:
Eno Wine Bar is a very nice little place.
They have a nice selection of wine.
They have some food/small plates.
The service was good, but not great and they are overpriced on wine and food.
I struggle with deciding if this is a 3 or 4 star location.
I'll go back and give them a try again next time I'm in the area and I suggest you give it a try too.
author: Douglas F.

description: Great service, friendly and welcoming. Food is tasty, music is chill, and lots of wine to choose from.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Wow! What a hidden jam! Great foods, variety selections of wine, attentive service and cool and calm ambiance.
author: Sayuri W.

description: The wine here was really great. You can't go wrong with their wine flights, generous servings for right around $25.  The food is okay, if you're looking for a spot for a light bite and wine, this is it, but there are not large meals on the menu.
author: Katie S.

description: Cute little wine bar conveniently located in the middle of union square. A nice and quiet little place to stop amidst your shopping to have some wine and a bite to eat. We ordered the baked Brie and the reserve cheese flight. They were both delicious and the cheese pairings were perfect. I also tried the Channing daughters red wine flight and my friend had the skin contact white wine flight and we both enjoyed them. I would definitely come back for some more delicious wine and cheese.
author: Ali M.

description: My first wine bar experience with friends! I thought this place was pretty nice, fun, and very helpful. In terms of service, I would probably give them a 5/5. The only thing that really made me decide to rate them 3/5 was selection. I wish there were more choices when it came to glasses. I'm more of a white wine drinker, specifically on the sweeter side, and choice wise was a little lackluster for me. The tapas and choices of appetizers were fine, but the only thing I would have hoped for would be better selection when it came to drinks. I'd give them a 3.5/5 if we could do half stars.
author: Li S.

description: I can't say enough good things. Absolute perfect end to my trip. Food, wine and chocolate. Great atmosphere and wonderful service!    What a treat.
author: Julie S.

description:
Some of the best things in life can be found here...
Wine.
Champs.
Cheese.
Chocolate.
Fireplace.

The fire is what honestly brought me in.  What can I say?  I love sitting by a fire.

The staff are pretty rockstar.  After doing a flight, our personable server introduced me to a stellar champagne.  Of course I don't remember what it was.  Why, oh, why did I not Vivino it? 

The best seats are the comfy sofa facing right smack when you enter.  Especially if you're w your main squeeze.  Romantic & cozy!

But, if you're in the mood for people watching, sit by the window.  This particular block of Geary brings quite the mix of peeps...art lovers, guests at the St. Francis, Lefty O'Douls imbibers, etc.  

The cheese plate is fab.  Perfect to nosh w your poison.  

And, they positively welcome you coming in & working on your laptop.

A good spot.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Great cozy and intimate wine bar right by Union Square!
This is my second time here, and it's just as good as the first.  They have a great selection of wines from all over.  I especially enjoyed the selections from Santa Barbara.
My friend ordered the sparkling wine flight, and I ordered the "Kicking Acid" white wine flight.  Both were excellent.  The wines were great, and I liked the fact that the atmosphere was classy, but not pretentious.  The tasting notes were fun and irreverent, and the staff was super friendly and knowledgable.  We had just eaten, so we didn't order any food, but other people had some cheese plates, and they looked delicious.
Definitely worth stopping in and decompressing from all the activity in the city over a glass (or flight) of wine.
author: Paul A.

description:
This place has become one of my go-to places in San Francisco.  I love it because it's never overly crowded and I love how cozy the place is!  They have couch-like seats and even a fireplace!  

I love the wine flights, which change with season. They give out wine flight cards that explain each glass, which is pretty fun.  

The only thing I've noticed is that when it is actually busy, service can be really slow.  They only have one waiter on a Saturday night? 

But other than that -- definitely one of my favorite hangout spots.
author: Michelle S.

description: Love this cute wine bar! Stumbled upon ENO after work and was pleasantly surprised, had a flight of wine and ended up buying a bottle because I loved one of the wines so much.
author: Allison S.

description:
Unbelievable! 
We live in the area and decided to try this wine bar in the heart of Union Square ( tourist area) because there were so many great reviews and the  wine menu looked complete and interesting. We were able to get a nice table at the window which is always a plus because there such great people watching in Union Square. We ordered some food and I decide to order a champaign flight. My husband was excited to order from the "bucket list" menu because there were some interesting old world reds that he wanted to try. The food wasn't bad as the charcuterie and salad were tasty. The flat bread came out pretty quickly and it was nothing more than a reheated frozen pizza. 
My hubby suspected that the wines he tasted ( half glass of each ) weren't consistent with he ordered and he brought this to our server's attention. She reassured us that the wines were indeed what we ordered by bringing over the bottle. He was very skeptical about the entire show but I thought he was just being picky so I told him to chill out. Then the bill came out. The bill itself was correct however the suggested tips were outrageously wrong.  Our total before tax was $125 that makes 18% tip $22.50 with tax out total was 135.94 and 18% of that would be 24.45. Their suggested 18% tip was 32.58! That's $10 more than it should be. I guess they expect tourists not to notice. Needless to say, we won't be going back. This is a chain 'wine bar' with a typical tourist area service , food and wine so I guess we should've known better!
author: Mary s.

description: Wonderful little place. We went for dessert and wine which was perfect. They have many different wine tastings paired with cheese and chocolate.
author: Laura D.

description: Nice little wine bar a block or so from Union Square.  The atmosphere is very cozy and service is very good.  Our server explained the various wine choices that we were interested in great detail.  They also have a small food menu to go with the wine.
author: Patrick H.

description: Awesome place .. Sonia very nice and looks like Selma Hayek .. nice atmosphere and they have a god playlist... Jayton knows his wines and he's definitely Baby daddy material
author: Angela K.

description:
This place is hella trendy. Cute & Dainty, breh.
This place got us feelin' some typa way.

Price: About $20 for a 3 wine flight.

Parking: Structures? Union Square parking.

Service: The Wine connoisseur were very knowledgeable and friendly.

Drinks: I love how the flights have little histories and descriptions of each wine. 

Food:
They offer pairings, but we didn't opt for that.

Notes: I would def come back to try their Port & Chocolate pairings. Slammin' music. Awesome names of flights.
author: Krystle T.

description: I came to this cute little wine bar on 08/19/2017 when we happened upon it on our way to dinner.  It is so inviting with it's cozy atmosphere and lighting.  The abmiance and friendliness of the staff is refreshing.  I had been in the mood for a Prosecco for a few days so this was my perfect excuse.   Oh my, did this Prosecco really fit my palate. Seriously, it was yummy.  I have tio say though that the service was only so-so.  The young lady who served us did not wipe the top of the bottle, not to mention she didn't keep her thumb on the cork.    I'm really a fan of wiping it down before you pour my glass!  Also, she never came back to refill our glasses and when I mentioned  this to the GM on the way out, he said they don't do that!  Are you kidding me!  When one pays $44.00 for a $14.00 bottle of wine, I feel a proper service is in order! With that being said, I am not complaining about the price and noticed some reviewers have.  Don't complain!  You are in The City enjoying yourself and they have provded a nice intimate spot in the bustle of things to enjoy your wine!
author: Kelly M.

description: Great atmosphere. Laid back vibe without the stuffiness that comes with most wine bars. Also loved the music.
author: Philippe P.

description:
Love the dim ambiance and the side tables to see out.  It can be people watching time while delving into charcuterie and wine. 

One can chit chatter and simply be a Wine-O here! 

I was cozying it up near the fireplace while enjoying the pleasant French earthly wine with the ENO signature charcuterie plate. 

Quite a romantic, date place.

Whether to do just that or simply dropping in for a drink, it's admirably a tucked away wine bar in the heart of downtown.
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Meh. The service was persnickety - i.e. they seemed to feel they were doing me a service to be there at all. The wine flight I had was average and a bit expensive even by San Francisco standards. 

Nothing terrible, just totally average. And in my opinion the folks there, if they read this, will turn up their noses and say "oh, he doesn't appreciate us?" Shame on him. (That's the attitude I got overall.)
author: Dan D.

description: Nice modern ambience and great service.  We tried a couple flights and they were good as expected.  The down side is that they don't carry too many wines.
author: Tom V.

description:
With a cozy atmosphere and a long wine list, this place is a great spot to come with a friend after dinner for a chill conversation. 

Service was very friendly but on the slow side, but that was fine, as we were not at all in a rush. The menu is full of funny/quirky details and descriptions, and has quite a few flights and suggested pairings. They also have a flight of truffles, which - of course - we got, and which was quite good.
author: Liz F.

description:
I was visiting SF for a conference when I found this gem on Yelp.  It's close to Union Square, near the Westin Hotel.  

We attended with one non-wine drinker, who was happy with the cider they had on tap.  The rest of us enjoyed flights of wine - some red, some white.  Our server was so knowledgable about the wine it was amazing.  We had some questions about what to order and he was able to match us with the best flights easily.  

We were all thrilled with our wines, passing them around the table for everyone else to enjoy.  I really like that they serve the wines with cards with the names and descriptions of the wines.  I always forget what I drink, so after snapping a picture I will remember the next time I'm at the wine store.

We enjoyed our wines with some nice meats, cheeses, olives, and chocolates.  Everything was delicious and we finished every last drop.

I would definitely return to Eno the next time I'm in SF.
author: Kathryn R.

description: Fantastic selection and I've had a lot of wine. So refreshing to see different varietals. Loved the flights and wines by the glass. Good for couples and close to Union Square. A nice break from the hustle and bustle of San Francisco.
author: Lisa M.

description: Not gonna lie, this place is a little overpriced. The wine is good and there's a variety if you are getting flights or full bottles, but by the glass is a little limited. Our service was attentive but the place is VERY dark, we had to use our phone flashlights to read the menu. The deviled eggs are good but they only give you four. That said, if you like a hearty wine, grab the Cabernet/Merlot blend I got, described as tasting like a "spring chicken". Not kidding, it was great.
author: Kristen T.

description:
This is a truly great wine bar in the unexpected location of Union Square. As SF locals, we have tried our share of loud and pretentious places. Eno does a phenomenal job of feeling relaxed from the moment you walk in to the moment the extremely knowledgable staff discusses your choice. 

We had 2 flights and snacks. Every thing was beyond expectation. These are some of the best wines we have had and I'm seriously considering canceling my wine clubs. It's rare to have an excellent atmosphere and excellent service/fare. We will be back to try more of their artfully curated wines.
author: Kara P.

description:
Super cute wine bar in Union Square. This place is walks from the heart that everyone takes a picture at :0) Came here to kill some time since it was the only wine bar in the area. Friendly service and a very comfortable environment - romantic, too :)

Their white wine flight was great and the portions were very fair for the price. Also ordered some olives which were just OK.

Good pre-dinner date night spot.
author: Anna M.

description:
Very nice wine lounge, well decorated and good wine selection. We stopped here for the after drinks cheese board and had to try their deviled eggs.

Everything was reasonably priced and we enjoyed spending our time at this place. I would come back.
author: Anelya S.

description:
Fan of the options and the ambience here! Boyfriend and I walked by this place on the way to an event and decided to double back afterwards. Right by Union Square, so parking is limited on the streets. I recommend the nearby parking structures (specifically the one on Sutter/Stockton St) or taking pubic transit to get to this area.

Walked in on a Saturday - early evening - and there was no wait. Found ourselves a table and seated ourselves (where we liked, of course!). Bottles of wine line the walls as a decor.

Plenty of wine choices on the menu. You can order by the glass or pick the pre-fixe wine flights they have to offer. They also have cheese flights and chocolate flights to pair with your wine flights!

We ordered the Urban Legends wine flight (red wines from the Bay Area) and the Pesto Flatbread to share. Pesto flatbread was cut into 8 pieces and served with garlic oil - tasty!

The only thing was our server wasn't super friendly. We would say 'thank you' when he came by to set our table, refill our water, give us our check, etc., but he wouldn't say anything back. Awkward...

A little on the pricier side, so if we're ever in the area again - we might try the other things they have to offer!
author: Wing L.

description: Cool wine bar in middle of union square madness. We had the baked Brie (delicious) and the reserve cheese board. I had the skin contact wine flight, all 3 wines were very good.
author: Dee B.

description:
Wine snacks were sooooo delicious! Definitely was impressed with the service they had to offer here. Waiter was polite and explained all the wines/snacks in detail. 

Will be coming back when I'm in the city.

Cozy place with a fire place in the back/bar in the front when u walk in.
author: Connie H.

description:
I just realized that my last two reviews started with the words, "what a find!" How unoriginal! Soooo...

What a discovery! 

This place is wonderful. The atmosphere. The food. The wine. The staff. Fantastic from start to finish!

Each of the ladies in our party of four started with a flight, and none of us were disappointed. The wine came with a card listing our choices, along with a description. I'm not a wine drinker, but I do like sparkling wines, and my flight was quite tasty.

We also dined there, and the food was delicious. Not a huge menu, and that was just perfect. Just light fare that was the right portion and flavors to compliment the wine.

Finally, our server was a pleasure- both charming and attentive. 

I'd go back in a heartbeat!
author: Mary C.

description: Who would have thought there was a cool wine bar right off of Union Square. If you were walking fast, you might miss it. This is a cozy place with small plates and a extensive list of wine flights. You will have the opportunity to try a wide array of different wines from around the world as well as California favorites. It has a bustling atmosphere but still warm and welcoming. A must try if you are my Union Square.
author: John H.

description:
I don't understand why this place got so many good reviews. I guess the location is good for tourists for a quick stop if you don't care for over priced wines. I've visited eno wine bar for several times for its convenience but I usually end up getting disappointed. The last time I was there, a glass they provided was not clean. A glass of wine cost over $15 even though you can purchase a bottle for the same price at a store.
Also, always check your bills!! Especially if you are a tourist, they could fool you.
Over all, I don't think I will ever come back again even though I live nearby.
author: Lana B.

description: This has to be one of my favorite wine bars in the city. Although I have to say I haven't been to all that many. I t is a great place to cap off a date and enjoy a flight of wine and chocolate. The atmosphere is very classy but more casual and less pretentious than I expected. The advice is always get what you like. Don't worry about pairings too much, which I like. I usually come here to introduce friends to the different varieties of wine while being in a great place to have a conversation. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone of all wine knowledge levels. Just be sure to keep an eye on the tab as it can get out of hand quickly ;)
author: Ryan J.

description:
Ugh, i am so conflicted here. 
The service was rushed and OK but i was told the kitchen was backed up.
We were lucky to get some flat bread and an unwanted pronounciation lesson but
i think we went during a busy understaffed night.
author: Zildheam D.

description:
Cozy & easy for commuting to the Richmond district.
This wine bar is part of the St. Francia hotel on the side facing Geary Street.
Dark warm wood interior makes this a lovely spot to hide out from Union Square shopping.
author: Joanna T.

description: Adorable wine bar in Union Square, I love it! They have a lot of different types of wines, but what caught my eye the most was the flights that they have! They have many different kinds of flights to accommodate everyones different wine tastes. The ambience is also very nice and relaxing, I loved it! We ordered the ENO featured winery flight and it was awesome! We got to taste wines hand picked by the winery from places all over the world. What I liked the most was that we got a mix of red and white wines in the flight! Overall, my experience at ENO was great. My only complaint is that the kitchen does close at 10 and I had no ideas about that. We got in around 10:30 and I wanted to order one of their cheese plates because they look so yummy, but they could not serve that after 10. So next time I will def go before 10:00 :)
author: Anisha K.

description:
More of a date place than a big social venue. 
Theme is on wine flight, more for wine novice than lovers.  For a wine bar set in SF, wish they are more creative on wine flight themes and offer a more diverse menu. 

Service is slow, on a Fri night that is not crowded. 
Ambiance is dim and main room stuffy.  Great location but lots to improve...
author: Bea W.

description: Great little wine bar super convenient to shopping and you would walk right by not noticing it from the outside. But once you walk in....you are transported to a charming wine bar, great wines by the glass and wine tasting flights, with superb service. I'm into good food, good space, good service and great ambiance and this place checks all the boxes. The waiter was super friendly, and even brought me a sample of two other wines, one was a Austrian Riesling which I loved. Oh and I forgot to mention a roaring fireplace. I will definitely return to this place on my next visit to SF.
author: Regina M.

description: Great little spot! Nice vibe. Love the wine flights and choices with great appetizer/meals. It's a go to when you are on your own traveling - lots of couples seem to like it too.
author: Manuela H.

description: Eno Wine Bar is my favorite wine bar in the city! Not only does it have an amazing selection of wines to choose from, it also has chocolate and cheese wine pairings. I've tried both the cheese flights and the chocolate flights along with the suggested wine flight for each one, and the cheeses and chocolate were rich and luxurious and the pairings with the wine were on point. My favorite thing about Eno Wine Bar is actually its decor -- soft dim light, seating by a fireplace, comfy seating -- it's so romantic and relaxing! This is a lovely place to stop by after shopping and dinner in Union Square. Bring a friend to help unwind after a long day or bring a special someone to round out a lovely date in the city. Either way, you won't be disappointed with Eno Wine Bar.
author: Pooja M.

description: Loved this little wine bar, it's cozy and the service is great!! Stopped by when on business in the city and had a glass of good Pinot and a chocolate sampler. They even offer half glasses so if you don't want to have another full one you can get a half!!
author: Katie C.

description: Nice comfy seat. Perfect if you like to people watch. a good wine selection and list. good quick bites so you won't get too drunk. It's a nice place I like to go after work to sit and unwind with. The have a good Moscato I've always enjoy. A good selection of Red wines. a few beer to try. and they bring you water. lotss of water. clean restrooms and you can basically just melt there and be happy.
author: Leme K.

description:
Wine and cheese and bar snacks - how could you go wrong with this combination? Eno definitely perfects it, offering over 50 different types of wine and a meticulously curated cheese plates. My party of 3 arrived at 8 pm on a Saturday to the surprisingly empty wine bar (great for us!) and sat ourselves at one of the tables with a comfy couches.

We took some time to decide on wine, but our server was very patient and helpful in giving recommendations. He also brought two wines for us to try, which helped in our decision making! In the end, we decided on a dessert wine, a moscato, and a cider - all very tasty! We also got the Cheese of Spain cheese plate, which had goat and sheep cheeses. I enjoyed the manchego in particular. The pickled grapes that accompanied the plate provided a refreshing, tangy contrast to the strong cheeses.

Overall, the wine bar offers great food and service! The ambience is also lovely and rather low key. It'll be a great date spot - especially if you snag the table right by the fireplace!
author: Julia N.

description:
Eno has wine bars in many major cities.... Chicago, Coronado, Laguna, San Diego, Washington D.C. and, of course, San Francisco.

Eno's SF location is great - just off Union Square.  Its a 3 block walk from the Powell Street BART, but that walk is a bit uphill.  The space is modern and well-lit, with a fireplace in the back room.  One negative on the space is that the two bathrooms are right one wall in the larger room and everyone knows everyone else's bathroom business.  A little curtain might be a good idea.

The wine list is amazing!  They have a wonderful breadth of wines in each category.  Highly recommend the wine flights to try as many of their unique wines as possible.

Our server was incredibly knowledgeable, but perhaps stayed at the table just a tad too long sharing their knowledge.  Answering questions is good, but doing a lecture is not why we came there. 

Highly recommend coming here a tad hungry and pairing some of the wine with the cheese and chocolates available.  Eno makes for a wonderful afternoon snack location while shopping at Union Square.
author: Joel B.

description: This place is super cute.. we found this hidden gem on yelp when we were shopping at Union Square. It's perfect! Tons of wines to choose from and they have flights as well. We only ordered a few food items which were great! A good spot to grab a small bite and a glass of wine during shopping.
author: Rainbow W.

description: Great wine bar. Atmosphere was relaxed. Smelled like a wine cellar. Great selection and fun flights to try.
author: Brendan M.

description:
The wine list here was fantastic. The waiter really understood and knew the wine thoroughly however he did make his own recommendations rather than base his recommendations on what type of wine we told him we prefer. 

Nonetheless we went with our preference which was the 2013 Harrington Nebiolo and it was just amazing. Truly one of the best nebies I've tasted.

The waiter did go missing with our second order for about 20mins but brought us a complimentary truffle tasting plate to compensate. I understand things can go wrong in a kitchen and the truffles more than made up for that. 

We had the 3 meat and 3 cheese tasting plate and this complimented our wine beautifully.

Highly recommend this place for any wine enthusiast.
author: Rebecca R.

description:
Need to get away from the hustle and bustle of union square?  Need a good drink to go along with that?  Enos is the place.  Let the rest of the family shop while you spend a moment enjoying life sipping some fantastic wine in a quiet place. 

Enos has a kazillion wines so you will find something you like.  Cant make up your mind?   Try one of the numerous flights with sparklings, whites, and reds.  

There are a just a few snack choices including cheeses and crackers but did not try them.

Absolutely fabulous union square get away!
author: Marcus K.

description:
My wife and I went here on a Friday night for dinner. It is a relatively small place with small tables and couches.

The disappointing aspect was the hostess/server. She was not welcoming or particularly competent. She gave us only one menu. Came by infrequently and we had to ask twice to get necessary utensils.

The wine selection and food however were very good to excellent. If you can get by this one server, I would recommend giving it a try.
author: Howard S.

description:
I came here to meet a client.  Since I came from far away, I got there almost 30 minutes early.  I told the person who was seating me, he was very congenial.  "Don't worry.  Sit down.  Do you want a drink now or wait until your friend gets here."

They have an amazing wine list, including glasses and flights.  They also have four bottled beers available, which was cool because my client wanted a beer.  (Go figure!)

They have several selections of cheese plates (we got the reserve plate) and several charcuterie choices (we also got one of those).

There are lots of nice, intimate places to sit and enjoy a conversation.  I would take another client here or go with my wife (if we happened to be in the area).
author: Gary A.

description: Everything was good. Atmosphere was decent, but not five star. We had a couple red wine flights that were good. Overall a solid 4 star joint.
author: Jared L.

description:
Eno wine Bar is an amazing wine bar with a great selection of wine. Several cheese and chocolate pairing are available. The bar is very cozy with low light, a chimney and dark colors make it a very intimate place for a date. 

R & I stopped here before dinner for a drink, we ended up having the bubbles flight and the Spain cheeses flight. The cheeses ' portions were very generous, came with a some pickles and poached pear slices.  

I really loved  Eno Wine Bar, the service was extraordinary, very helpful and knowledgeable. Ask for any recommendations and they will gladly help you. 

My next time here I will definitely have a red wine flight paired with a chocolate flight.
author: Tamara S.

description:
I am really torn about this review because I feel that this place could have lived up to its potential - but too many factors made this a three star.

First, love the concept of a wine bar. My husband actually went to an Eno Wine Bar in Chicago and had such a great time there, so he really wanted to come here.

We first went there at 2:30, only to be informed that it actually opened at 3pm. When it was 3:05, we went back and were told that it actually opened at 3:30. At this point, our friends wanted to have drinks at Cheesecake factory but it was going to be about a 25 minute wait. While we were waiting, we though well if we are going to wait the same time for Cheesecake, let's go back to Eno. Thankfully, they were open.

They didn't have three of the Nebiollo (bottle and glass) options from the menu (disappointing), but the waitress mentioned why not do the Nebiollo tasting. When we pointed out that one of the Nebiollo choices (which came in a bottle version and one we tried to order) was not available, the waitress than said, oh we have another one. Okay...

Then, we ordered several cheese plates and asked if one choice was the soft cheese, as indicated on the menu. The waitress than told us the kitchen decided to swap it out because...well the kitchen just decided. Okay...

All in all, this is a great romantic place and love the concept. But it felt like this time, there were just too many things missing, not available, replaced etc... without us knowing which was...annoying and disappointing for a wine bar. In fact, my husband said that the Eno in Chicago would tailor each cheese to a wine making the experience very personable. So overall, an a-ok experience for me.
author: Charlotte W.

description: They have a great selection of wine and cheese. This is a good venue for ladies night out or a rather intimate date.
author: Klarenz D.

description:
I'll bet you've never heard of Eno Wine Bar.

It's...
A cozy reprieve from the neverending hustle and bustle of Union Square.
A casual lounge offering well-edited international wine and bubbly flights (and some with bold names like 'Sex, Bubbles, and Rock 'n' Roll. Ahem.)
A godsend for offering cut-to-order cheese and charcuterie to complement all that wine intake.
An unlikely savior for always having a table available.
A spot to catch up with girlfriends, escape from winter's chill, or perhaps launch a make-out session.

A secret no more.
author: Jelena Z.

description:
I came here for a little get together with friends as I heard Eno served chocolate and wine flights. Eno Wine Bar is a lovely, cozy bar with a great menu and wine selections. They had cheese, wine, chocolate and even deviled egg flights which was a fun way to try everything. The décor was classy and cozy, perfect for catching up with friends. 

Food:
1. The flatbreads are AMAZING. Seriously, you have to get one in every flavor because they're all so different but so great. The bacon and goat cheese flatbread was hands down everyone's favorite, but the tomato flatbread was addictive too. The flatbreads are crispy and down right umami, you will not regret getting this.
2. The appetizer platter - I quite enjoyed this. The cheese, bread and meats were all delicious, but I might not order it again as it was good, but not a standout. (Probably would just get more flatbread)
3. Deviled Egg flight - give this a miss - each of the deviled eggs tasted like a regular deviled egg with topping on it which really wasn't worth $3 a half egg. If you really want delicious deviled eggs, District has fabulous siracha deviled eggs which are worth paying for.
4. Wine - we picked out a bottle of syrah that was served chilled (!!) for some reason? We didn't absolutely love it, but it ended up growing on us later in the evening. I would definitely come back to do a chocolate and wine flight tasting the next time :)

All in all, I had such an amazing time at Eno Bar and wouldn't hesitate to go back. The only downside that made me take off a star was the snobby service. When we got into Eno at around 6, it was still pretty quiet, we asked if we could sit in the back and the waitress very rudely waved us off and said no they were full. I went to the bathroom a few minutes later and saw lots of people in the back, seated cozily by the roaring fireplace :/ Strike one. Throughout the rest of the night the waitress was just really rude and dismissive when she served us and forgot our orders of water to go along with the wine. All in all, I really wanted to love Eno, but the service definitely left a bitter taste at the end of the evening.
author: Sarah T.

description:
Whoa, something near union square that I keep coming back to! Not bad Eno's.

Amidst the touristy & social problem stricken vortex of Powell street + union square, there is a cute non touristy date spot.

At first it's easy to mistake it for yet another entrance to the St Francis hotel, or a lingerie-turn-touristy-art-studio, but once you walk in, the whole vibe changes.

Calm atmosphere, fairy roomy, and friendly service. Prime seating is by the window for some people watching, or in the back room with a fireplace.

Good selection of wine, although I'm not the pickiest here -- I've never sent one back :)

For eats, I recommend Eno's "sampler". Small charcuterie plate with cheese and delectably intriguing pickled grapes, which can act as a backup conversation topic, if you end up needing one :)
author: Artem A.

description:
The wine selection here is extensive. My best friend is a somm, and we went here just for that. When asking the server a pretty basic question about one of the wines, it was immediately apparent he didn't even understand the question but tried to answer anyway and gave a really stupid answer. 
We found a great bottle to enjoy, but dude, if you're a server and don't know something, don't pretend like you do know!
author: Jenn G.

description: I've avoided this place for ages since it's right in Union square, but was pleasantly surprised. Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable for us as neither of us knew anything about wine. They did a great job and helping us select a good bottle without trying to upsell us. Atmosphere was super chill too. I'll definitely come back here. I like the vibe a lot better than the Press Club.
author: Mandi W.

description:
A wine, cheese & chocolate bar in Union Square that's NOT a tourist trap? There is such a thing! 

Eno is a glittery gem on this not-so-glamorous strip of Geary. The neighborhood is quasi-Union Square, quasi-Tenderloin, but you'll forget all those distinctions once you're lounging by their fire, popping truffles into your mouth, and washing them down with sparking Malbec. Indulgence is the rule here. 

The wine list (no, book!) is impressive, with lots of flights and glasses to choose from. They seem to have a good balance of easy-drinking wines, and a few obscure ones. That way, they're not isolating any wine novices or disappointing any vino nerds. Like any pro wine bar, they'll bring you tastes to help you find the perfect glass before you commit. Huge rounds of cheese and pretty painted truffles fill the refrigerator, so you're likely to say "yes" to a pairing. 

Eno is more of a slick wine lounge vs. a rustic wine bar, but not in that "trying too hard to be cool" way.  There are two rooms: one feels like more of a cafe, the other more loungey and intimate. I suppose it's nice to have options, but we felt like the cafe side was a little less luxurious. 

It's a classy joint, but not too classy to deter you from coming just as you are. In fact, we came straight from Kabuki Springs - wet hair, bathing suits in bags, mascara running - and they still gave us the posh treatment. Merci!

Plus, they're open til midnight, even on weekdays!
author: Nique F.

description: Nice cozy atmosphere. A little step away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Lots of pillows to sit on and neat little window tables to watch people scurry by. Also a romantic fireplace in the upper level. Always ask the hostess about the back part of the restaurant. We Saw many people be shown away from that part. Food was good but expensive. Wine good but a little over priced...but hey its a wine bar.
author: J D.

description: My husband and I had a flight of wines here. The wines tasted a little above average. We chose not to have any food with them. But we were told there were certain places we couldn't sit and the service was slow. There were very nice people watching views at the windows, but we had to sit at the far side of the room next to the bathrooms because we were only two people. It was an average experience and I probably will check out other places before I consider this Wine Bar again.
author: Jan L.

description:
Went in today to meet some friends for some wine and cheese. We've been here before and have always had a good experience...until today. 

It was busy, but they had open tables. There was a couple in front of us waiting to be seated. 

Several wait staff walked by us numerous times and never even acknowledged our presence. We informed the bald headed waiter (didn't get his name) and asked him if we could sit at the open table near our friends. He very rudely said no. 

Our friends informed us and the couple in front of us that there were two open tables in the other room, because they had just left that area. The couple in front of us asked if they could be seated at one of those tables and the bald headed waiter told them they couldn't sit there and that they would not be seating anyone for about 20 minutes, because they had to "slow things down". Really? He was so rude and unprofessional. It made no sense to us so we left. We will never return.
author: Al P.

description: This was one of the most weird experiences I ever had at any establishment! My friend and I walked in, the hostess was extremely curt. She sat us down and we looked over the menus. We ordered an appetizer but she keep wanting us to order a glass of something but being that we just spent the last few hours on bottomless mimosas, we politely told we wanted to eat first; she looked quite offended and placed our food order. Then a short time later, this little odd man comes out of no where and places this huge vase with flowers right next to me on the window sill because I guess that's what they do there. It almost seemed like he was trying to hide me from the public since we were sitting by a window. And then I started to ponder if we were white, would we have received such disgusting service? We got up and left! We didn't even get to eat.....Terrible, horrendous experience.
author: This Is M E.

description:
A lovely wine bar neatly tucked away from Union Square's hustle and bustle. I came here with a friend just before a show at the theater around the block and we were quickly seated at a booth next to the window.
