The server was knowledgeable, friendly, and routinely checked to make sure our glasses were full. We only ordered the Eno Experience platter and were satisfied with the sampling. 

Would come back to enjoy some of their other plates.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Great spot. I found it just meandering around Union Square.

The service was friendly warm and very helpful.

The retail prices for bottles are a bit too much, but as a wine bar, its exceptional.
author: Steven B.

description: I'm not exactly sure what makes this place so amazing.  People watching was decent. The two of us had some pricey wine alongside the Eno Experience (3 meats, 3 cheeses).
author: Patricia N.

description: Worst service ever. Never even got seated - or acknowledged - because they were "backed up." There were - at most - 5 people in the bar.
author: Tommy G.

description:
Came in around 6PM on a Friday as we were going to a theatre event around the corner. Asked for a table for 6 - the place was completely empty.

The stars are for the exceptionally poor service we received. It took about 20 minutes to put in our order, and we had to get up and request service at every point after that because we NEVER saw our waiter - to order food (had to contact the manager, who tried to track down our missing server, another 10 minutes), to get the bill we had to track down the waiter ourselves.

They added a service charge onto the bill without telling us, so worst of all we ended up paying double in tip for the NON-SERVICE we received. It took us 2 hours to get out of there after ordering only a wine flight and a charcuterie board or two.
author: Fay V.

description:
While in San Francisco for work I stopped by Eno Wine Bar for a nightcap. I'd walked by earlier in the evening and when it popped backed up on my radar via the Yelp app I decided it was fate. 

ATMOSPHERE: Sexy dim lighting and comfy seating that's perfect for a first, second or seventieth date. Located right off of Union Square it's the perfect break from the insane crowds and noisy traffic. As I sank into my seat my heartbeat settled down and I went into relaxation mode.
 
PRICING: Very reasonable at $15 for the wine flight and $12 for the cheese flight. The three wines we had came with lots of information and it helped me mentally prepare my palate for each first sip. And you really can't go wrong with gourmet cheeses, plus the assortment was well rounded.

SERVICE: This is where Eno won me over because the two handsome servers we had were excellent! You could tell they were true wine geeks and gave us so many great suggestions. We felt very well taken care of and we learned a ton about the wines we were drinking!

If you love wine then you'll feel right at home in Eno Wine Bar. Can't wait for my next jaunt to San Francisco and another nightcap or two or three at Eno!
author: Emi H.

description: What a wonderful and romantic place. Great place with wonderful people working there. Wine selections are great, different kinds of cheese , various olives, grapes etc. Really convenient location near Powell.
author: DJ Nocturna R.

description:
LOVE IT. The staff is SO knowledgable and didnt even bat an eye or hold up their arm to backslap me when I asked how I should drink and eat the wine and cheese. Do I drink first? Eat the cheese first? Other way? Leave the cheese in my mouth then drink? Drink then pop some cheese in my mouth?? Anyway the flights are wondeeful. I had the chance to taste some similar wines that were different in their own special way.  I loved pairing it with their suggestions of cheese. And they just didnt plop our wine and cheese flights down and walk away, they described each wine and cheese and even gave us a card to reference. Unfortunately for my cheese flight I didn't get a card so...

CAN SOMEONE TELL ME-- what the name of the blue cheese that tastes like a western bacon is?!? PLEASE?!?

I had to put caps up there so hopefully it will catch someone's eye and they'll know. Trust me that cheese is LEGIT.. Even tried calling in 3 times to ask but got their answering machine :(

HELP SOMEONE HELP!!
author: Annie A.

description: Greeted warmly when I walked in. Seated at the window. Glass of sparkling in my hand and Zombies' Time of the Season playing. VERY high marks.
author: Ken W.

description: Erica is a great hostess and sommeliere, with nuanced and accurate recommendations, and - hello! - she actually listens to customers and hears what they are saying.  The portobello flatbread is a great accompaniment to reds.
author: Paul D.

description:
Kindle: check
Sushi place around the corner for dinner: check
Art galleries frolicked-within: check
Rosé time: check check check

Eno was the perfect spot for a glass of lovely rosé while I waited for Toni Sushi to open around the corner. It's an intimate space with comfortable chairs, beautiful flutes for sparkling and just the right level of service for a gal greedily consuming the contents of a book (or two) via Kindle. The Notorious RBG is one bad mamajamba, FYI. With the low, cozy lighting I was in a zone. I also could have taken a delicious nap.

I looked with envy at the decadent cheese plates being served left and right. Had I not been hankering for fresh fish I may have succumbed to the temptation; the rest of their menu also read like a dream. The pricing is totally reasonable, especially for SF. If you're looking for a spot to relax between your CA adventures, or you want to relax without an adventure, or you want to drink something - whatever your predicament, just go here.
author: Deji M.

description:
After reading the reviews we decided we had to go to Eno...I mean, we dig wine. The wine was great!  Unfortunately the people working that night were having a hard time, they were very frazzled.  For example, the three or four people working there were having a very hard time with the number of customers in attendance.  Yes it was a Saturday and yes it was busy, but these employees seemed to not know how to handle the stress of front of the house operations.  They actually turned away business more than once instead of telling people to wait 5 minutes for other guests to leave.  By the time we left after one flight (almost 10pm), the couch in front was open and so were a couple tables.  These could have been filled again if they hadn't turned away the business earlier.

Never-the-less, the atmosphere is very comfortable, dark and relaxing.  The wine selection is rather vast and the flights are reasonably priced.  Next time in town, I'm going back, but it will be when there are fewer patrons hoping for a better experience.
author: John A.

description: The wine bar other wine bars wish they could be. Sure, they're in the middle of a gross touristy district--but tourists haven't totally figured this place out and I think locals dismiss it because of the location. Bonus: the playlist is stellar. Thumbs up.
author: Cassandra J.

description: A cozy and hip oasis from the hustle and bustle of touristy Union Square. Have been to this wine bar a few times for early evening drinks now and it's always great. Interesting wines, good snack menu, table by the fire place is romantic. Service is always friendly.
author: Renee C.

description:
I was delighted to find a Brut Rose sparkling wine on the menu for a reasonable price that was really delicious. More full bodied and complex than most of the Brut Roses out there. 

The appetizers were tasty. We tried the deviled eggs, bruschetta, and one of the charcuterie plates. I was a little shocked when the tab came how much "damage" we did. It was a great spot though to catch up with a friend after not seeing him for a long time. 

Service was friendly. I like the dim lighting. Location is right in tourist central but as others have mentioned, doesn't have a "touristy" feel to it.

I'll be back.
author: Erika A.

description:
A glass of Gamay on a cold night next to a warm fireplace.
this is one of the places in San Francisco  which has a great selection of wine. I have been here once before. The have nice sommeliers who made sure that I was comfortable and also explained about the wine. I have tasted the flights last year. 
It's a good place for wine enthusiasts. Definitely coming here next time.
author: Kirandeep K.

description:
Surpassingly we found this excellent wine place near our hotel near Union Square.
I ordered Granite Flight  ( Burgundy , Nebbiolo  and Bonarda and found myself  in tasting heaven. Highly recommend it. 
The Sheep / Goat cheese flight was very good too.
Our server was charming and  helpful with orders.
Very pleasant ambiance backgrounded with the lounge music. Lovely experience !
author: Dani O.

description: Absolutely fantastic.  The staff, the vibe...top notch.  The ability to have a seat by the window and drink wine while people watching is phenomenal.  Great music (think Tribe Called Quest type speed with the beats but no voice).
author: Jared T.

description: The wine selection has gone down dramatically and the vibe of the places seems to have gone down too...
author: Sameer B.

description: Cute little place in union square. Great selection of wines and the ambiance is classy.  Tried a couple of flights and some cheese plates. It gets packed after 7pm.
author: B P.

description: Date night here was amazing. The ambiance is perfect and the selections are great. We had a cheese flight and had one of the suggested wine pairings. Perfect together!! The cheeses were very good and paired perfect with the wine. Not very loud in here either so you can have a nice conversation without it being hard to hear.
author: Brian H.

description: Nice respite from the busy hustle and bustle of union square. They offer wine flights. I chose the CaliReds and was quite happy with the selections. I also really enjoyed the deviled egg flight, especially the seasonal pomegranate and cracked black pepper. Would definitely return if I visit San Francisco again.
author: Karen B.

description:
Was visiting SF for a couple days and stayed at a hotel near Union Square.  Before leaving, I wanted to make sure I visited a wine bar and check out its selections.

Yelp directed me to this location and was not disappointed.  Since I was 2 blocks away from Union Square, this place was relatively closeby and really enjoy the ambience at this location.  While it was dim inside, its really a nice place to hang out and enjoy the company you're with.  Was lucky to get seated at the window fronting Geary Street so was able to check out the activities going outside.

They had a great selections of wine, from mid- to high-range wines. Got there kinda late so didn't have much opportunity to order food from the menu..  The server we had was every friendly and knowledgeable! Was in the mood for Italian wine and was recommended a very splendid, medium bodied Italian wine.. 2009 Badia di Morrona N'Antia Toscana.  

With good company and good wine, you can't go wrong here!!  Definitely a place to visit next time I'm in SF again!
author: Dalmacio C.

description: Great little place hidden just outside of union square with great wine and food! If you are visiting San Francisco and hanging out around union swayed, take few minutes to yourself and check this place out. Let your legs and body rest, order wine and food and you won't be sorry. My good friend works here as a cook and his food is delicious!! Always feel at home when I come to visit. I love tasting wine and when I find a good one, I will take my time to appreciate it. This place has never disappointed me! Come and visit and ask for Peter Buck, he will take a good care of you!!
author: Nuno V.

description: Staying over in San Francisco after a convention, I was looking for a place to relax and enjoy a glass of wine. Found Eno on Yelp and, as it was just a few blocks from my hotel, I headed over. Found a nice comfortable seat by the window, perfect for people watching, and ordered the California red flight. What a superb wine choice that I savored in a comfortable, no rush, and friendly atmosphere. They also offer a limited food menu, selected to complement the wine. Highly recommended.
author: Gary L.

description:
so glad i finally tried this place! i saw it when it opened a while back but was a bit skeptical since union square is such a tourist trap, but i was pleasantly surprised!

came here on a date night with a gf and our mutual guy friend. its right around the corner from BCBG and right where the 38 bus stops - super convenient!  i started with a flight of reds, and gf had the champagne flight, which she loveeed. i was happy with mine as well, and we promptly finished before the dude got there. boys.

then we all got flights of red, and 2 flatbreads- duck confit and the vegetarian mushroom one (terra?) which were pretty good. they were on the drier side, but flatbreads are served with a bit of olive oil for dipping - perrrfect.  our server was funny and helpful, and described all of our wines with great expertise.  

ambiance is good - we sat by the fireplace. there are couches and tables for 2, 4 or 6, which is perfect for friends gathering.  i would also come here with a good book, or sit by the window and people watch. will be back - and to try their chocolates!
author: Christina L.

description:
I really enjoyed ENO. First thing that will catch your eye is the decor and the ambiance that will sweep you away from the bustling business of union square with wood tones, fireplace and of course wine! 

They don't take reservations unless is more than 8 people. But don't bother calling them because they don't pick up or return voice mails which is quiet upsetting.. but I got over it after I had my wine experience here.

You can feel comfortable dropping in without a reservation as it's pretty easy going on weekdays. 

Customer service is great, friendly + knowledgeable. 

I did the century club wine flight which was a bit disappointing... Tasting these w wine helped but not much. If you're doing a tasting and you're a wine connoisseur then opt for the more expensive tasting flights or do the bubbles tasting.
author: Sarah K.

description:
For the sheer amount of restaurants and tourists in Union Square, you'd think there would be more awesome wine bars. Eno is probably one of the better in the neighborhood, just because there's rarely a wait and the selection pretty good.

If you're into bubbles, there's a lovely flight worth trying: Sekts, Bubbs, and Rock n' Roll, comprised of Valdo Brut Prosseco (Italy), Rocher des Voilettes Montlouis Petillant Originel (France) Solter Sekt Riesling Brut (Germany) = very generous pours for $17

Or you could just go for a lovely Pinot rose by the glass. Pairs very well with the Heidi cheese plate. Yes, we love Heidi ;)

They can accommodate groups, though split checks are tough to negotiate. I was there recently with 5-6 other ladies and try as we might to offer our credit cards with a monetary amount, our server was not having it! We ended up making it work, but yeah, way more stressful than it needed to be.

Overall, a quiet and unassuming Westin gem. Even if you're a local, Eno will satisfy the pickiest of winos.
author: Abby S.

description:
Such a cute wine bar tucked away right in the heart of union square. I've been to this area so many times but Eno Wine Bar has never caught my eye - I think this is a good thing because this is one of the few places that I've seen in SF where it doesn't get overly crowded on a Friday after work. 

They have wine flights, wines by the glass, and I think beer as well. The wine flights are very reasonably prices. Around $18 for 3 generously large tastings. I really like how they bring out the flight with a little info card to explain a little bit about each wine. I got the rose flight and they were all very unique wines. 

We also shared the spain cheese sampler. This was just ok, some of the cheeses were a little too strong for me and I thought it was a little pricey for the small amount of cheese they give. 

Basically, I would recommend this place for a fun and classy happy hour or pregame. It's a cute, intimate place with lots of seating so don't be discouraged because it's in the heart of touristy union square!
author: Malika R.

description: After walking around SF, it was time to unwind and relax.  So I stopped into Eno and ordered the Kicking Acid white wine flight (3 types of white wine selections) a thorough description of the wine,region and other pertinent information is provided on the flight tray. I also ordered a small platter of cheeses, breads, olives, prosciutto.  The ambiance is calm and mellow, just somewhere to relax, talk and hang out with friends in a nice intimate ambiance.  The prices are reasonable and service was great.
author: Val R.

description: This place is shady and will try to rip you off. Don't forget to double check your bill! We were a group of girls just trying to enjoy our book club and they tried to take advantage of us by overcharging us $80.  When we approached them about the discrepancies in the bill they acted like we didn't know how to do math. It took 40 minutes for them to admit that they screwed everything up.  Even then they were not apologetic and never fully owned up to the responsibility of screwing up the bill. Please don't support these jerks with your business. They are highly disrespectful to their patrons and unprofessional in the way they run their business.
author: Maya G.

description:
Love this haven in the midst of the kinda chaos outside. I was looking for a late night place to plug-in, work (Wifi!) and sip some bubbly. Eno was there for me. 

I was staying in the French Quarter and every cute little wine bar/cafe was packed and/or didn't have WIFI. Merde, I thought and consulted the Yelp app, which pointed me right in the direction of Eno.

Cheese, a variety of bubbly by the glass, dark, cozy, yes yes yes. Wine bar perfection.

PS. Not sure I'd agree that they qualify as "pricey" - seems on par with just about any  other wine bar.

PPS. CHOCOLATE plates, too? Next time...
author: Joi B.

description:
I'm gonna have to give it a 3.5 stars. If you like going to Union Square, you'd like this location. Sit by the front window and people watch as you sip your wine. 

Easy to get to by way of BART or Muni. I went directly after work to meet up with a friend. I hopped onto a BART train from Embarcadero to Powell station, walked the 2-3 blocks and I was there in no time. 

Staff just kinda stared at us quizzically which was slightly off-putting when we walked in as if they were confused about why they are there. But they ended up being attentive and service ended up being just fine. 

I will say the chocolate flight was slightly  disappointing. At $11 you get three 1" X 2" rectangles of chocolate. Don't get me wrong, they were delicious but thought it was overpriced in my opinion. 

The cheese flight was good. We chose the "Don't have a cow" which comes with two firm and one soft cheese. The soft one I didn't care for as it was hardening and a bit too firm for a soft cheese. Tastewise - nice.

I didn't see many items listed on their online menu when we peered through their menu upon arrival. Most notably the peach and burrata salad was missing which was a bummer since I was planning on ordering this among others. 

Overall a decent wine bar to catch up with a friend as the noise level is low enough to carry on a conversation at a normal decibel. Or just drop by to unwind after a hard, stressful day at work.
author: Esther A.

description: If you love wine give this gem a try. A great date night spot with a cozy feel especially near the fireplace. The staff was very knowledgeable and gave great recommendations. I will definitely be returning to ENO.
author: Jamaal M.

description: Very cool, friendly staff that knows their stuff. Highly recommended!
author: Johannes B.

description:
I'm usually somewhat particular about which wines I drink and am rarely truly satisfied with the wines I taste at bars. 

I tried three reds at the wine bar connected to the hotel I was staying at (Hotel G) and wasn't satisfied with any of them. The food was also nothing to write home about. 

Then I found Eno just down the block. I tried six reds over three days time and every one tasted amazing! I mean they were so good that I just kept pushing away from my usual choices to try other options and never had a wine I didn't like. 

I'm usually a Cab guy, but their Melbec, Zin, Cab, Merlot were all exceptional. My favorite was the Claret, which was simply amazing. 

The staff was very knowledgeable and the food was also great. I'll go out of my way to visit here on my next visit to San Francisco.
author: Ben W.

description:
Cozy spot with fun wines and window seating that makes for amazing people watching.

I came with a small group so we opted for a bottle. The malbecs were the only big reds within our price range, but the one we chose was great. I think next time I'll go for a flight instead though!

The only reason I'm giving this spot four stars instead of five is because the cheese platter was pretty skimpy. The cheeses were great, it just seemed like the portions were unreasonably tiny. Regardless, I'll be back!
author: Megan B.

description: My friend and I came in here before going to a concert at ATT park and had a flight and a glass. The atmosphere was great. We sat on couches. The service was great. I would definitely come back here again!
author: Diana H.

description:
This review is in regards to an attempted visit on a Saturday evening. I've been here once before on a random walk in and had a relaxing time with great wine with a female hostess. 

However this time, it was a bit more crowded than before and upon entry the middle aged male host with a buzz cut avoided eye contact immediately and did not seem to want to acknowledge my girlfriend and I. Eventually he decided to let us know he would be "right with" us. 

We stood awkwardly waiting at the entrance for about 7 minutes watching the host making rounds with all the tables without once checking in with us, or letting us know that it will be a 10-20 minute wait or anything. 

We had a dinner reservation to catch so we decided to ask if we could seat ourselves at which point the host turned around and SNAPPED at us snootily saying "....NO. you will WAIT. As you can see we are a little FULL here. How many are there of you, TWO?" at which point he offered to seat us at this super dark table in the middle of the room. 

After this snappy and uncalled outburst there was NO way we were going to stay and wait for some awful service. All you had to do was be up front and let me know about how long the wait would be instead of just ignoring us and snapping at us when we asked a simple question. Sorry you cannot handle your workload or answer a question courteously. We will not be frequenting this establishment again.
author: Steve W.

description:
We had an amazing time in this cozy wine bar. I'm a social drinker but the wine was so strong that just one glass was enough for me! I ordered Bueyes Cabernet Sauvignon, Mendoza, Argentina and it was awesome..
Everything including interior design, our waiter's attitude, taste of wine and appetizers was flawless.
If you're looking somewhere to relax and enjoy a glass of fine wine, this is a good option.
author: Shirin Z.

description:
Just visited your San Francisco wine bar yesterday evening, before theater at ACT! Loved the food and wine but the music was really annoying. Hope you'll change the music--and then I'd rate it a five!
Music doesn't fit the atmosphere, wine, or clientele! There was constant mariachi-type music playing fairly loud, and the servers couldn't modify the volume or content. This is a continental or California-style menu and ambiance - so the music should go with it!
author: Kathryn S.

description: What an incredible wine bar! A must go to! Our server, was SO knowledgeable and such a pleasure. The food exceptional! Can't wait to return to this intimate find. A++++
author: Susan S.

description:
Charming little wine bar, loved the ambiance here, from the lighting to the music in the background, to the light chatter. I love coming to Union Square area, and I've honestly never noticed this place but glad I did tonight. 

I am a fan of their Wine Flights - You have the option of choosing from a couple selections of wine; you get 3 half glasses, with a little card along with it describing the wine. I went with the Ph - D (I think). Not too bad, and it compliment the turkey sandwich I ordered as well. 

My pro's and con's

Pros:
The atmosphere of Eno is very inviting and warm. Space is limited, so accommodating a huge group may be difficult. Servers are friendly and knowledgable, sometimes a little frazzled, but its ok, as long as I have my wine, you can be as frazzled as you like. 
Didn't know there was a little backroom with a cozy little fireplace as well. Bathrooms are in the back as well, wouldn't even know they were the restrooms unless you got closer and saw the signs. 

It is a little pricey, but then again for $17 - you get 3 small glasses of wine, and I'll admit, but the time I got to my third, I was feeling it a bit, so not really a con per-se. 

That's really it, nothing bad about this place, just surprised not more tourists are camped out here drinking wine, since its nestled in the middle of tourist country.
author: Laurens D.

description: Fantastic assortment of wines, flights were well paired and food that accompanied and complimented the wines very well thought out! Must come and visit if you are in the area and love your vino!!!
author: Anthony N.

description: The wine was good the service was not. Having to ask for water 3 times before 8 min later getting some with attitude was frustrating. Follow that up with pushing certain picks on us and then messing up our dessert order I can say that I would pick another wine bar over this one next time I am in the Union Square area.
author: Lindsay M.

description: Awesome experience! Loved every minute of it. The server was really sweet, and the wine and cheese and truffles were delicious. Definitely a must, I will be back on my next trip to SF!
author: Sam W.

description: Prime seating right near the entrance at the couches was perfect. Split some wine flights and had a blast.
author: Melissa C.

description: Sure, it's pretty pricey, but my goodness the drinks are so damn Class. Purchased two flights of wine (1 1/2 of a glass of wine) and it was too legit man, so so good.
author: Ayush T.

description:
This place is amazing!!! I'm in the city for 1 night and needed a comfy spot I could enjoy solo. I hop on Yelp and behold - Eno is just a block away. 

I've been comfortably seated by a warm fireplace for at least an hour and a half, reading news (on the super fast and free wifi) munching on the duck flat bread and pear pecorino salad.... Yum... Super yum (be sure to ask for the red pepper flakes with the duck)! 

My super big bold wine flight is also fantastic... This is a wine bar after all...And I'm pretty good at drinking the nectar ;)

The service is great - super attentive and extremely knowledgeable about both the food and wine selection. 

Do it. Just go here. You won't be disappointed.
author: Christin M.

description: So far loving this place. Both times I've been here, it's been a little empty. Not sure why. Service was decent and a decent wine selection. They have some of the nicer wines .
author: Tiff W.

description:
What a pleasant surprise the heart of Union Square.

I mean, when you're walking through Union Square, who knows what to expect!  But Eno managed to complete the quaint yet lively space with just the right amount of local SF character. 

So the first thing when you walk in - there's this very interesting U-shaped bar table that could be a perfect seat for you and your peeps.  The front room also has proper bar seating that works well for that up-close and personal interaction. But my suggestion would be to walk on over to the back where you'll find a little more comfort and privacy, along with a big ol' window for people watching.  Yes, you may notice a few tourist feet walking their way inside, but the room is intimate enough that it shouldn't bother you :)

That said, a TON of great wines on the menu.  More interesting is to talk to the owner, Joel, about where he sources his wines.  I mean, variety is the spice of life, but it doesn't get more local than this. Wines from SF winemakers (yes, those urban-esque SF spots like Bluxome winery and so on).  Combine that with some interesting choices from across the globe.  

As far as bites go, food is decent.  Nothing that screamed at me, but I highly recommend the bruchetta plate. 

Any-hoo, Eno is definitely a must-stop-in-again-after-work or anytime that I need a break from that Union square hood craziness.

Eno, NICE JOB!!
author: Angella S.

description: My friend and I met here for a quick glass of wine. We ended up staying and relaxing for a few, and some great cheeses and olives and really enjoyed the atmosphere. Great for people watching and not too far from anything. Knowledgable server was spot on and the flights were very well selected.
author: Krista I.

description:
Great section of wine, loved the fireplace in the side room. 
Appetizer and got a few slivers of salami and cheese for $20 bucks, but you gotta pay those downtown prices.  Had a date here, plenty to talk about, choose from on the menu and people watch as they go by.
author: Michael C.

description:
Great place to wind (and wine) down. (ohoho lame joke)

Very casual, and has a great selection of wines. I recommend the sampler options, you can try 3 different types were a very good price.
Service was great too- our server took the time to walk us through the menu and explain each wine we asked about.
author: Rumi F.

description: Had a blast trying the wine flights here! The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Nice place for a date or girls night out.
author: Melissa M.

description:
Don't BS me . I'm happy with an effervescent wine that stays that way for the whole bottle . Wine doesn't lose its effervescence on the second glass , then get it back again .
It maybe an organic wine . I am not an organic person , so please do not keep me in the dark and feed me BS. I'm not a mushroom
author: Paul B.

description:
This place is fantastic. 

They have some pretty rare and interesting wines here. At a reasonable price. 

My girlfriend and I had an incredible glass each and their truffle sampler which put us at  $55. 

The service was also really cool. Both of the servers were kind, attentive, and knowledgeable. Would come here again indeed.
author: Chris O.

description: Convenient location off Union Square.   Friendly knowledgable service with great food and wine pairings. Perfect comfortable place for a light wine and food pairing before dinner.
author: John M.

description: awesome wine bar. Great wine list, fantastic appetizers and amazing ambiance. I did not feel like was Ina bust city. It was great.
author: Keith C.

description: Was not really happy with the service here. The best part was the cheese. I felt like the waitress didn't really pay much attention to us. We came on a Saturday night only because it looked cute from the outside. it's very cool and inviting. But I thought the wine was overpriced for the amount poured. Overall it was okay, but there are plenty of friendlier, and more welcoming restaurants in town.
author: Ameera D.

description: Nice ambience but some of the elements of the wine and food pairing were not to my liking.
author: Ross S.

description:
It was my first day off work since finishing spring semester & I had just gotten my hair done for the first time in over a year. I had hoped to find a happy hour with a friend or two, but everyone seemed tired so I went out on my own. I love wine and cheese (known for it actually) and wanted to discover a new place nearby. Eno was just a few blocks away & had great reviews so I went.

I ordered a wine flight & a cheese plate. The wine came within a few minutes. The cheese plate took over 20 minutes (I had texted someone when I ordered so I knew how long). I had tried to not drink a full glass of wine because I was obviously waiting for some food to eat with it. I felt pretty sad & pathetic waiting by myself in this wine bar for some cheese that wasn't coming. My waiter was nice though and apologized a few times, and took the cheese plate that eventually came out off my bill.

If it wasn't for him, I would have given a horrible review & definitely would have never come back. He was nice though, and the wine and cheese was good. I would like to try this place again in the future, and hopefully update to a better review.
I will not go by myself next time though.
author: Samantha M.

description: Best place in San Francisco. If you are a Wine lover don't waste your time trying to find another place. They also serve the best cheese, charcuterie and chocolate in the tow. Witch means you don't even need to leave to have a dinner. The music and the ambience are calm but charmy, there is a fireplace. The service is great, they can tell you everything about every wines and figure out which will suit best to your taste. Ah, and of course the selection of wine is fantastic. I just came from Napa and I found fantastic wines there, but definitely here you can taste better wines in a shorter time span. Stop reading and come.
author: Guilherme L.

description:
A friend clued me into this haps little spot a week or so before the "grand opening." Situated just off of Union Square, this place is a great spot to stop and enjoy a glass or in my case, a glass + a flight of delicious wines.

The wait staff was attentive, the service was great, wines and apps were delicious and the ambience is classy, understated and hip. Would be a good place to meet a few friends, or bring a date!

I will definitely be back.
author: David H.

description:
Great little place if you're looking for a relaxing glass of wine near Union Square!

I came here with a few girl friends last Friday and we had a great time. We came during prime happy hour time (6:00pm) and I was pleasantly surprised to find the place chill and uncrowded. 

We sat at a table and ordered a bottle of wine, a cheese plate (goat & sheep) and a pizza (coppa). All were fabulous! We then ordered a second bottle of wine and, as you might expect, that one was even better :) 

The servers were attentive and friendly as well, so that was an extra plus. I think we each ended up paying around $30 which is a pretty decent price for the area. The atmosphere, at least while were there, was pretty relaxing and quiet - would be a nice spot for a date. Definitely recommend!
author: Lindsey B.

description: I had been meaning to try this place out since it opened. Finally, I made it down and wasn't disappointed. Everything was awesome. The service was great - I mean, with all the selections, it's definitely nice to have someone who is knowledgeable about what you might like. I was there on a lazy Sunday but it would definitely be a great date night spot to relax, chat and do a flight.
author: Leina K.

description: Passion Pit, Bon Iver, and the Pixies playing. Couch area, grilled cheese with roasted tomatoes, good wine.
author: Jessica W.

description: A calm oasis in the middle of all the hasty stress around Union Square. The wine bar is nicely decorated and has fireplaces and good chairs. The selection of wines are good and I chose a wine flight of whites. Unfortunately I just came from dinner and a way to big (and not all that good) chocolate cake, so I had no room for testing the tempting cheese trolley. A good spot!
author: Hildegunn N.

description: Nice place but when I order my cheese and meat platter they didn't tell me they ran out of one of the meat until they put the order on our table. Also they spill wine on the lady next to us and she's pretty piss. Wow bad service bald guy!
author: Molinda S.

description: Service could have been better. We asked for a table in the back and the staff moved other people but did not accommodate our request. We asked for water on three occasions before our waiter delivered some. The wine and cheese tray was lovely.
author: L. D.

description:
OMG I love this place.  Went on a date and as soon as we walked in he goes "this is every girl's dream".  He was right.  Wine, bread, and cheese - pretty simple recipe but it doesn't get much better than that, does it?

The atmosphere is lovely.  Soft lighting (very flattering!) and quiet surroundings.  The cheese plate was delicious, the bread very fresh.  I even tried my first deviled egg - quite fancy for something that came out of a chicken's butt :)

Oh, right, and the wine was AWESOME.  And very reasonably priced for the area.  

Great service, great food/booze.  What's not to love?  I'll be back again next time I'm in SF!
author: Becky M.

description:
Cute little wine bar with  couches and wine and cheese.  Not too crowded on a weekend.  Snack are available.

You cannot enter Eno from the hotel behind it.  Enter from the street across from Lefty Odouls.
author: M S.

description:
Greatest things that I've discovered here thus far are their wine flights, plus conversing about them with the observant and amicable waiters. There is a whole back story behind each glass within the flights, and part of the fun is hearing the details of each drink. Some are much more full-body than others, some are more fruit-forward, but that's what wine tasting is all about: there usually is a progression from weakest to strongest in the series.

I've been here twice so far, trying a different flight each time: "The Hills Have Vines" the first time, and "Cotes to Coast" the second. The Grenache in their Cotes to Coast flight hits the nail on the head beautifully.

Another nice element of this wine bar is the simple ambience of the atmosphere. Everything, from the downtempo/shoegaze music in the background, to the warmth of the center fireplace, to the cozy home feel in that the place is not jammed packed with 100s of people... An appealing place to unwind.
author: Garett T.

description:
Amazing location, amazing experience. The waitress was knowledgeable about the wines they offer, food was well presented and tasty. The decor is inviting and warm.. and to top it off, the chocolate tasting was a big plus.
Next time you're strolling down the busy streets of San Francisco, turn around the corner, a block away from Union Square and treat yourself to a little wine and tapas. It was a perfect time out for me and my company.
author: Matea F.

description: Obviously either the host was being nicely rude or  just discriminating on the fact that my friends and I looked young. The host said they were full but I'm pretty sure the empty seats and tables don't make the restaurant full. My friends and I were looking forward to drink some wine here and drove all the way out to the city for this. This is definitely not how I would not want future diners to feel, unwelcomed.
author: Roxanne D.

description: Had so much fun and the wine flights are awesome. The cheeses and charcuterie looked great, hoping to try next time. Also loved the ambience- so cozy.
author: Alona G.

description:
I just love this place so much.  So much so that I went three times in 36 hours.   The wines are amazing, the cheeses are awesome.  Had a great time trying different flights of cheese and flights of wine - all put together creatively and beautifully.   Little notecards come with each flight.  

The service is awesome.  Feels like you're in a special small town wine bar.  The people who work there actually really care about how you are and whether you're enjoying your selections.  I had some really nice conversations with several of the workers.

Eno is different than most places in the Union Square area.  It feels cozy and organic and is the furthest thing from a chain kind of establishment.  

Oh - if you're staying in the area, go THERE for a bottle of wine to bring back to your room - excellent wines at retail prices.  Skip that rip off of a bodega across the street and treat yourself to greatness.
author: Scott H.

description:
Lovin this hip little wine bar in Union Square! The ambiance is cute and casual. The wine is great. They have many food options which I can't wait to try the next time I go there. There are two main areas to sit in. The larger area has a fireplace and beautiful wood accents.

I am curious how many ounces are poured in a wine flight because they are quite pricey. Will have to investigate that next time. This time we just had a glass on our way to dinner and it was very enjoyable. 

I look forward to coming back here with friends and family on many more occasions.
author: Elizabeth V.

description: This place was great and i really enjoyed the atmosphere. The wine flights were awesome. Me and my husband enjoyed their cheese flight. The good server even explained the different tastes and fron where they were produced. Highly recomend this place. The service was abit slow but the cheese & wine made up for it. I would go back here again.
author: Natasha M.

description: It is a surprisingly pleasant calming yet hip haven in the midst of that god-forsaken Union Square place that has been spruced up to look like a plaza in Cincinnati or Akron -- they didn't know it was in San Francisco? -- but I diverge. The Eno Wine Bar was a great place for 4 of us to visit and sip. The wine was tasty and pricey as you would expect for this area. The staff was nice though not really attentive enough. Strangely when one of us asked for ice to go with the soft drink she had ordered, she was told the only ice they have is too dirty to drink. That's a new one. Her honesty at least was appreciated.
author: Aria J.

description:
Wine flights were good but a bit on the expensive side. Cheese flights were surprisingly ample in size. We also had the duck flatbread, which we really liked

Our server, who was dressed as an amateur magician, is the reason for the low review. He seemed annoyed to talk us through the flights, and when we asked for a box to take home leftovers, he said they didn't have boxes for cheese (but he'd try to make something work. Oh wow, apparently normal  to go containers work for cheese too). Icing on the cake, when we asked if we could possibly order one piece of chocolate, the waitress kindly let us know that Walgreens was still open and had lots of yummy candies!) 

We won't be returning and will be sure to share this experience with our friends in sf.
author: Lara B.

description: Take a break from the crowds around Union Square and duck into this cute, cozy wine bar. Grab a seat by the fireplace, some bites (loved the Deviled Eggs sampler) and some flights (great selections- definitely something for everyone). The staff is attentive and knows their stuff, and it's the kind of place you can enjoy solo, on a date night, or while entertaining your out-of-town guests.
author: Leslie W.

description: Loved this place first time we went. Second time, went by at 3:30 still not open. We waited til 4 and they still were not ready to open.  Will not be returning.
author: Tara E.

description:
I've passed by this spot for several months now, but recently decided to check it out. The atmosphere is a bit like mission cheese, everything is explained, except the focus is on the wine not the cheese (though both have excellent cheeses). 

They have preselected flights of wine, not cheap, but amazing. The service is great, and location is good as it is central enough from union square to stumble into, but not visible enough for it to be a tourist hotspot.

Will be visiting again!
author: Sam M.

description: Really beatifuel place! Very good service nice wines a good place to take a date! Nice spot to take some wines and relax
author: Jose S.

description:
nice selection of reds and good small plates.
a good place to hang out for wine drinkers after work
service was good, cozy atmosphere
author: Marie r.

description: Had such an amazing time here! Our server was super sweet and very helpful! (I don't remember her name) We got the bubbly taster and the Nebbiolo taster. She helped us customize a cheese plate which paired perfectly with our drinks! The atmosphere was perfect! Very romantic! I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Naomi R.

description: This is my favorite stop on the wine tour tonight. Fantastic host - Micilio! Great recommendations including Urban Legend - tereldago!
author: Mike K.

description: Situated right in Union Square, this is the perfect spot to stop by after a long day of shopping for wine and cheese. They don't have a happy hour but their prices are reasonable. I would recommend getting a wine flight - 3 glasses (with very generous pours) for $18. Our waitress helped us pair our reds with a flight of 3 cheeses as well, which went nicely with our wines. I love the ambience of this place - very relaxing and intimate, with dim lighting and a cool glass fireplace.
author: Angela K.

description:
been here several times and it always hits the spot no matter what your needs are: celebrating your cousin's engagement? check. celebrating your main gay's birthday? yep. discussing bridesmaids dresses with said engaged cousin while your boyfriend is super bored staring into the fireplace? done.

eno has a variety of delicious wine tastings (BUBBLY TASTING YAAS) and amazing cheese plates. highly suggest for a cozy night out when you want it to feel intimate and kind of like a cozy night in. wine for the win!
author: Reyana F.

description:
I was in San Francisco this Memorial Day weekend (and back home in SF permanently soon), and one of the many things I've missed is proper customer service and innovative off-the-wall menu items. Eno is a delightful reminder of what I've been missing down in LA.

LA is many things, but the unrepentant divas who staff their service establishments wouldn't know customer service if the Apple Store Goddess branded it on their foreheads with the iPad of Truth.

That being said, Eno has one of the best wine selections I've seen. Not in terms of sheer quantity, but in terms of innovation. It's refreshed often, and the selections all have a purpose and should open your wine palate to something you haven't considered.

Usually most wine bars have a pretty generic selection, it's just a generic mess of NorCal tasting grapes and tannin after a while. But these selections should revitalize your tongue.

Their kitchen is also open until almost closing. Union Square unfortunately is pretty dire in the food situation, being the tourist trap that it is. You won't get a 24 oz ribeye here, but there's a selection of small plates that were very interesting.

In San Francisco, I expect proper service since that's where the bar is set. And Eno didn't disappoint. Friendly, professional, and attentive. We weren't left waiting to place orders for additional glasses, or to close out. Nor did I feel rushed despite it being a busy Saturday during which they could have surely turned over more tables.

If you're in Union Square, and you have wino blood, definitely check it out.
author: Rishi G.

description:
Hubby and I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place!! We go to a lot of Giants games during baseball season, and we usually stay in the city. We make it a point to come here every time! 

The wine flights are amazing, the cheese flights are to-die-for, and now they have "real" food, too! Try the eggs (deviled eggs, but served warm-ish); they are delish. Have I mentioned the truffles?!?! The truffles!!! They are the perfect way to end the whole experience. 

Come in, sit by the fire, watch the hustle-and-bustle on the street from the large windows, eat cheese & truffles, and forget the rest of the day! That's what always happens to us...we come for "one flight", and usually end up staying for hours, and booking an extra night in the city. The owners know how to suck you in (in a good way)! :)
author: shana l.

description:
First time visiting Eno Wine Bar and we had a great experience.  Kim gave us some great advice on Wines and Cheese dishes to sample.  We ended up ordering the Nebbiolo a trio of Italian wines from Northern Italy.  Along with that the Formaggi D'Italia, a trio of cheeses from Italy to match.  Kim suggested we substitute the Blu del Moncenisio cheese with the Red Hawk, and that was a good call!  Every wine and cheese matched each other.
The ambiance was just what we were looking for, relaxing sitting by the window and people watching.  The price was very reasonable.  Definitely would go there again!
author: Damien K.

description:
So glad I finally went here! Had such a great experience the first time, I went back later in the week with another of my wine-loving friends. I walk past Eno every day on my way to work. 

    The staff here is fantastic, blending an excellent knowledge of wine, a great sense of humor, and a cozy atmosphere to really allow their customers to enjoy their experience. 

     Their selection is impressive and even includes wine made by their employees! How cool is that?! Their chocolate and cheese flights are just delicious. How can you NOT love strawberry balsamic truffles? I am so looking forward to taking other friends here!!
author: Ariel B.

description:
That tall, blond schmuck of a waiter is extremely rude and unprofessional. I'd fire him in a heartbeat. First he was boasting that we could try wine on tap before ordering a bottle, and when I asked, he said: "Oh, so you just wanna drink some free wine?" 

This is the kind of waiter who is poorly trained. He sees someone his own age, below the average age of the clientele, and thinks we're friends and that it's ok to joke around. We're not friends, I don't hang out with servers. 

It would also be a good idea to learn how to pronounce the names of the Argentinian and Italian wines you are trying so hard to promote, in order to seem a little less like an imbecile.
author: Tracey W.

description: Really nice little wine bar. Great selection and the food I had was really fresh and well presented and perfectly matched to my wine.
author: Richard S.

description:
A nice little place off Union Square, and a good place for a bit of wine, food, and conversation. 
The wine list is varied, but not enormous. But they have some really interesting stuff. (The Croatian wine I had was very different. I liked it!) 

The food is quite good too. I had their turkey bacon club sandwich. The sandwich itself was good (but not huge like most clubs) and the salad that came with it was utterly fantastic--very fresh leaves and a fantastic dressing. 

Nice ambiance. Bright enough to see, but dim enough to give it a nice feel. Staff was good, giving me time to ponder choices as needed, and asking if I needed anything soon after I finished off my glass. 

My only criticism would be to expand the wine list a bit more. As a wine bar, a few more selections would be nice. (They have a good number, to be sure. But I just want more, more, more, I guess.)
author: Br. S.

description:
I dream about this place! Wine is epic. They always help me with suggestions to fit my wine mood that day and the food is absolutely amazing! 
Grilled cheese, cheese plate, flatbread sandwiches  all to die for! 
Must try for evening out with the ladies, a great first date spot, or just lounging enjoying the people watching outside!
author: Sarah D.

description:
Omgosh my first ENO experience was amazing! My friend recommended this place and also all the reviews were fantastic. I was really excited to come here with my boyfriend before seeing a play at the Alcove Theater. I love that it's close to Union Square but not where it's crazy busy. Immediately when we walked in I fell in love with the size of the place and its ambience. It's quite swanky, yet very casual, and noise level was average. You can definitely hold a conversation. The lighting was just right how I like it. Felt very comfortable and relaxing. We chose to sit on the couch by the door. The pillows were comfortable and the everything was clean. 

The waiter was friendly and allowed appropriate time for us to check out their menu. I did, however, wished he had asked if it was our first time there and made recommendations to us. Would have been a nice offer, but he wad great nonetheless. I got the bubbles flight. My boyfriend got a flight of red (romance on the....something I don't remember haha). We also got the cheese and meat sampler with the bruschetta. Everything was delicious and tasted amazing. We topped off our meal with a glass of moscato. I LOVED it. Totally wanted another glass if we had not had to leave for the play lol. 

We are definitely coming back!! I love this place so much. I like small places like this. Everything was just perfect. Hopefully next time we're there our experience will be just the same or even better. We're also planning on checking out the ENO in Half Moon Bay as well :)
author: Lina H.

description: Short and sweet. Good wine, good value, the cheese/meat/(one)chocolate plate was good...the service...meh. It got so bad that one douche customer in the restaurant kept fake coughing and whirling his glass in the air for attention, which is total shite, but the server was literally just leaning on the front of the counter, doing fuck all for a majority of the hour we were there. Maybe he's the owner? Doubtful. Anyway, it's a good spot right of Union Square, and the a/c was blowing, which is a rarity in SF on an 85-90 degree day.
author: Ian S.

description:
Loved Loved Loved this place. So glad we came here. I loved the service and the atmosphere was super comfy and warm, did not feel we were in the busy and touristy Union Square. This place is cozy and was the perfect spot for a nice conversation.

What I loved the most, was how much knowledge our server had. He was on point recommending us and talking to us about each of the wines we tasted. We had two flights, I recall trying the California flight because I love pinots. Our server told us stories about each of the wines, and I loved it. We also shared a plate of cheeses, meats and chocolate..Yes! the whole point of coming here was to indulge ourselves and we certainly did. portions are fairly smalls, so this is not the place to come if you want to just get full of cheese, unless you want to spend more money. Every cheese was so delicious and paired so well with our wine selections. We ended up with a chocolate bite that also paired well with our last wine.

This is a super cute place for dates or just to get out of the busy streets in SF and relax. It is certainly a place for wine lovers and to just chill and have a good experience. Super cozy and loved that was not crowded at all.

Will definitely stop by again. And, lastly, prices are decent. Of course the better the wine the more you will spend, but I felt many of their selections were very affordable for the most part.
author: Elizabeth D.

description:
This is one of the nicest wine bars I've ever been to. The atmosphere is super cozy and the servers are extremely friendly, helpful and quick. They have a decent wine selection at acceptable prices, not by the bottle and glass. Make sure to try their flights: 3 generously poured half glasses of nicely matched wines. Just wonderful if you don't exactly know what you should get.
Also their food menu deserves to be mentioned: whether you like cheese, chocolate or hearty snacks, you can get it all. The menu could use a few more nuts though. But we tried their truffles and they were excellent. Looking forward to another night at this place!
author: Daniel W.

description:
Had the flight of sparkling wines and the reds.  Enjoyed most of them.  Fun to try different wines.   

We really loved the flat bread with caramelized onions and coppa, wow!

The seats are somewhat uncomfortable but this place is really nice for date night or chatting with friends.

The only neg is the service is super slow.

We walked here from the Mark Hopkins Hotel after listening to an interview with Kathleen Turner.  Which was really fun and interesting.  The evening was very balmy and plesant.  A perfect San Francisco night.
author: Foodlover B.

description: really nice little wine bar right off union square . nicely decorated with comfortable seating, lots of seats by the window for people watching. cool lounge music. interesting wine selections from around the world. we had a cheese plate and olives with bottle of wine. the only negative of our ecperience was chasing the waitor down for a check when we were done. kind of frustraiting, but besides the server it was a nice evening.
author: John C.

description: Loved the place. Very cute and cozy. Amazing selection of wines. Cheeses were delicious and coming from a French guy, that's quite a compliment. One of my best discoveries!
author: Johann Q.

description:
I honestly don't know a great deal about wine but this place gets four stars partially for the ambience. Great vibes and place to unwind with some friends at the end of the week.

I ordered one of the red wine flights mainly because the description said the wines included were illegal in 48 states, only to find out that it wasn't true. That little disappointment aside, the wine was decent. We ordered a cheddar cheese plate too which was ahhh-mazing. Complemented the wines so seamlessly.

Eno has a prime location too, right next to Union Square, which is perfect for relaxing after some shopping/dinner. It is pretty small (which is why their bathroom doors completely blend into the walls like camouflage!) but they've done a lot of smart interior designing to open up the space which I appreciate. If you're looking for a meal they also have some basic options like the sandwich my friend ordered and also sell wine by the glass or bottle if you'd like to have it with your meal so it's a place of many dining possibilities.
author: Junes S.

description: Excellent selection of wine, cheese and dark chocolates!  Great service and good location.
author: Mayra N.

description:
What a spot! All low lights and gleaming wood, it's modern but cozy. Being able to enjoy a tall elegant glass of sparkling rosé surrounded by a comfortably chic environment is one of my favorite things...and enos delivers in spades. 

After a giant meal of Indian food and beer, I was full ta bursting but I was lured by the thought of a classy glass of wine with my lady coworkers. stepping into this cool spot was exactly what I wanted. Our server was a touch snotty but we enjoyed our wine and chocolate at the end of a bug evening. Great for dates, drinks with friends or a last stop of the night.
author: Kelly S.

description:
Came here after sushi and shopping in union square while looking for something warm to drink.  Funny as we were looking for a wine bar after leaving BCBG and turned left instead of right.

Anyways we get here around 1030pm and loved the vibe, the style and mostly the menu.

My gripe with there menu and reason for minus one star is there single glass wines didn't have a ton of variety.  Bottles did but single glasses not so much.  When I come to a wine bar, I would hope to have more than 1 type of old vine Zin on the menu.  However the Zin was very good :-).

Will def be back.
author: Tiana S.

description: Really comfortable, quite, relaxing environment which is perfect to enjoy wine with your friends. I came here with my friend and enjoyed a cheese plate and a bottle of riesling wine. I was kind of surprised that the environment was very cozy and quiet that you don't need to yell at your friend while drinking wine. I will come back soon!
author: Sue K.

description: This is an adorable hidden gem in San Francisco's Union Square.  My partner and I came in here after a busy day sightseeing and it was the perfect place to recharge and sip on some amazing wines.  I opted for the "Grumpy Old Vines" flight and he chose a lighter and fruitier flight.  However, I was immensely pleased with my selection.  The Rimbert 2010 "Carignator" from Languedoc, France is the most pleasant wine I've had for my taste, and its floral scents are tantalizing.  The service is also very warm and friendly, which was a nice break from the crazy rush everyone seems to be in around Union Square.  I'd highly recommend coming back in the future to see what new flights they have.
author: Jackie W.

description:
AMAZING. I've been here on several occasions for small impromptu social gatherings with a couple of girlfriends and loved it. The wine selections are fantastic, the food options pair perfectly with the wine and the ambiance has the feel of a well appointed lounge. There are a lot of options to imbibe around the Union Square area, but you are looking for a place that prides itself on having the best of everything an oenophile would want - this is the spot to go. 

In addition to all the great wine and food, they have standout service that sets them apart from the cookie cutter hospitality service you get from the average establishment. The ENO team is passionate and knowledgeable, truly going above and beyond to ensure you have an enjoyable experience. This very mantra was put to the test last night as we hosted a full buyout event for 200 people. The quality of the food and drink along with the stellar service did not waver despite the number of people being served. The staff was always friendly and professional and all of our guests were extremely pleased with the food and wine spread. 

I wholeheartedly recommend ENO for a casual glass of wine to unwind or as a venue for your next special bash. When it comes to serving a small table to a large party, they maintain a standard of excellence that reflects the pride they have in their establishment.
author: Stacy T.

description:
ATMOSPHERE :: calm and relaxing, clean, cute decor

WINE LIST :: not bad, wish they had more flight options, specifically an all pinot noir option.  they may have one for cabs (meet the cabernet family?) and maybe all french champagnes?

SERVICE :: two different guys waited on our table.  neither were overly friendly (i don't recall seeing a smile from either of them, at any table).  the taller/skinnier guy was pretty knowledgeable about the wines they served.  it didn't seem like the other guy wanted to be there.

bottom line, i will come back.  it's a great place to relax and have a drink or two of wine.  union square is often times hectic and chaotic w/all the tourists, shoppers, etc. we felt *shielded* from that chaos.
author: Tina F.

description: As an "out if towner" I look for places that feel luxurious but comfortable. Eno met every expectation. The Double Cream Cheese flight was perfect with the lovely rosé that was suggested to me. This is a must visit before, during or after a day in San Francisco.
author: Johnna T.

description: modern chic, wood and dim...safe haven from union square bustle...calming feel inside...cozy and nothing large...larger table and seat near entrance...smaller romantic setting back...fireplace and clean...glasses of wine north in the $nine to $fifteen plus range...wine, sandwich and eggs ordered...refreshing glass of white...a fancy french ham and cheese sandwich in $ten range...great quality sandwich and great deviled eggs delicious...attentive and friendly service...good rest, drink, bite and farewell...
author: Hen A.

description: This place fine.   They didn't have the wine for their showcase flight of Nebbiolo but made a suitable substitution.   Went right at opening and the wines tasted a bit open like the were from yesterday.  App that I ordered was fine.
author: Eric S.

description: This was suprisingly cute/quaint for being right adjacent to the hustle and bustle of Union Square. It was the perfect end to an evening to hide away in one of their many cozy booths. They have a great selections of wine that are on average about $11-17 per glass. Great, friendly service as well!
author: Sharon H.

description:
This place is amazing and I almost wish it was in my neighborhood instead of in Union Square. I would totally be a regular if it was. 

We walked in after dinner and wanted a glass of wine. However, we couldn't decide so I got a flight of the bubbly wines and it was a GREAT decision. I loved the wines that they had chosen and I would choose any of those three as a glass anytime. In addition, chocolate flight? YUM. 

The place has a great atmosphere. They have couches when you first walk in and it's a great place to just catch up and hang out. 

Next time I'm in the area and wanting wine - I'm going to skip Press Club and come to Eno instead.
author: Nina Y.

description:
Great spot to unwind after a day walking around the city. 
Right near Union square. Easy to go. Loved the atmosphere   Wood and great light. A fire place and bottles all over. 
Just had a couple drinks but nice selection of wine. And even better you can buy a bottle and bring it home. Nothing better to extend your night.
author: Dai W.

description:
Fabulous haven in the middle of the chaos of Union Square!

I had four hours to get some work done before an appointment and didn't feel like going back home, which would have made me lazy, nor battling a crowded coffee shop. I searched on yelp and Eno came to the rescue. It's apparently a new place and it's already charming many San Franciscan and tourists alike. 

First of all, the ambiance is really nice! I love the wood, the lighting, the big people watching windows and the fireplace. It's very classy and relaxing. Definitely not a "scene" bar, but a place where you can have a good conversation with a date or friends, or even enjoy yourself, like I was doing today with my work. Oh, and they have wifi, so I could comfortably sit down at a table next to a plug and get hours of work done. Nice touch!

I was amazed by the good selection of world wine, as opposed to most wine bars in the region which focus more on the local Californian ones. I chose a nice red Italian. It was bold and spicy, just the way I like it, and I savored it throughout my whole time there. Oh and did I mention that the prices were very good? I took a look at the food menu - and the dishes people were ordering around me - and they all seemed really nice, albeit limited. They have a couple of salads, a couple of sandwiches, a charcuterie plate, different types of bruschettas, and cheese and chocolate flights. I had just had a big lunch and skipped it, but will definitely nibble on something next time I'm around.

The service was super nice and although very attentive, I never felt rushed. He even brought me a taste of another Italian red when he noticed my glass was almost empty.

Looking forward to coming back for a flight and some of that cheese and chocolate! :-)
author: Simone W.

description:
What a fun place! My fiance and I were visiting for a 3 day weekend and our hotel was just 2 blocks away so we passed this place while strolling the streets. I also saw that it had high reviews so we stopped in late in the afternoon. 

It is a little pricy... only downside. I had two glasses of wine and he had two beers, plus we shared a flight of cheese, bread, nuts and chocolate = $85!!!

But the service was just perfect, he was very knowledgeable, I was able to say what I usually drink and like and he found something that I fell in love with! We also had a nice warm seat against the fireplace. The view of the street is a little funny, people walking by would sometimes stare at us but it was fun.
author: Kayla L.

description: I love this place!  It's intimate, cozy, with a fire place, and has excellent service!  I was very skeptical based on the Union Square location, but I was so happy with my experience.  I had a flight of whites, but then I wanted to try something different by the glass.  They gave me 2 additional tastes to determine what I would most enjoy.  They are very knowledgeable and friendly.  I would love to return!
author: Stephanie R.

description: I went here on a date and we had a great time! We each got a flight of wine and shared a flight of chocolates which ended up costing around $50. The ambiance was very romantic and we felt comfortable relaxing and staying a while. The waitress was knowledgeable about the wine which enhanced the experience. The presentation was beautiful; the chocolates had the name of the country written on them and "Eno" was written in chocolate shavings on the plate. Each glass of wine in the flight came with a little card with information about the wine, which I thought was a great way to do it. I've been to another wine bar that had a binder full of lengthy descriptions about the wines and it was too bulky and awkward to flip through while you're enjoying your wine. I would definitely recommend this place for a romantic night out or for a cozy place to catch up with a friend.
author: Christine B.

description: Great place to stop and enjoy a glass of wine or a light lunch during a busy shopping day! Came one evening for wine and cheese flight and went back the next day for lunch! Very knowledgeable servers, and varied menu. You won't regret a cheese plate!
author: Sarah W.

description:
Forgettable. Atmosphere is nice, although they could use more soft seating. Staff wasn't welcoming, but they were attentive enough. Ordered two wine flights and a cheese flight, all were OK however they brought us the wrong cheese plate. We also ordered the deviled eggs. We were surprised they were warm. Under seasoned, and under stuffed. Eggs were different and I got the feeling that they were just sitting there, waiting for someone to order them. 

Overall, nice place to stop by and have a glass, if you're nearby. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here.
author: Shayne S.

description:
My review is slightly biased as I know both Joel and Steven from their time with Savvy Cellar in Mountain View.  Yet, as I don't venture up to The City much, the fact that I've been here twice does mean something.

This review is after my 2nd visit.  My first visit was with friends during Eno's soft opening.  While the service was great, the wines were familiar (not a bad thing), tweaks to the decor needed to be made (lighting) and the small plates menu was a work in progress...but fell in love with the bruschetta flight immediately.

My visit on 6/19 was met with nice improvements.  Lighting/decor was great, the small plates menu has been updated and was introduced to new wines.  Bonus: love that they open at Noon on Wednesdays, so I had ample time to hang out and get a little work done on my computer (free wifi!).  The new staff members that I met were welcoming and accommodating.  It was a great way to spend the afternoon.

I look forward to changing my rating to a 5-star one when I make an evening visit.
author: Alicia C.

description: We went there on a Saturday.  What a great experience, nice quiet setting to enjoy are wine flight.  Great selection on wine.  Our server was delightful and knowledgeable.
author: Sales A.

description: What an unexpected find,  the servers are very attentive & welcoming. The establishment is clean & comfortable.  I would definitely return here if I'm ever in the city again.  I highly recommend Eno
author: Tracy H.

description:
Thoroughly satisfied with the wine selection, quiet atmosphere (this was a wed night), and the friendly staff. Check it out for a chill evening and enjoy the great wine and cheese. 

Did I mention the good service? The server was kind enough to promptly replace my full glass of red wine when I noticed that a fruit fly decided to swim in it. 

Bonus: She also gave me a small taster of one of their other wines. 

Thank you!
author: Joanna L.

description:
Very quaint place.  Just opened up.  Was there on a Tuesday after work.  Place was about 10% filled, but only because they're fairly new and the word hasn't gotten out yet.

Their selection of wines is very eclectic.  Don't expect to find many local napa or sonoma wines here.  They have a variety from all over the world.  Their flights are very well put together.  I had the "gateway drugs" flight and was thoroughly impressed.  I'm not a big French wine fan, but the one that was in the flight was very good.

They don't have a kitchen, so don't expect any meals here.  But they do have a good charcuterie selection.  I'm not a cheese fan, but they also have a cheese plate.  I'll let someone else review that.

The hostess/sommelier, Cassandra was very friendly and knowledgeable.

Service was very good.  Maybe it was because it was a slow night.  Let's see how it fares in the coming weeks when the word gets out and the place is more packed.

Come now before it gets packed and try all of their offerings.

I'll be back.

EDIT:  Almost forgot.  I tried their chocolate flights too.  "sometimes you feel like a nut" was all nutty flavored chocolates (3 pieces) and their "breakfast of champions" which was all breakfast food flavors.  All, very good.
author: Christopher C.

description:
Loved it! A little europe in San francisco!
It became my favorite spot in town.
Best place to have some wine, cheese and chill.
author: Fernando Y.

description:
Amazing. I came here after seeing them pop up as a new wine bar near my office, and all of the 5 star reviews are totally correct. They have a super extensive list of wines - the first page is all flights, then they have a few pages of wines by the glass, and then their list of bottles. 

I tried the Kick Ash Whites flight which was great. Our waiter knew a TON about all of the wines and the regions they came from, and when we finished our flights he was able to recommend a couple of great wines by the glass. He brought over a few and let us try them. He had a great personality and really made the whole experience. I'll definitely be back for more wine :)
author: Lauren D.

description: Amazing date night with cozy fireplace and great wine flights , the port flight was particularly fantastic
author: Jacob D.

description: Excellent ambiance, service, and uncrowded. Came here with a friend after work to do some wine tasting. We ordered a flight which came out to be $18 per, which was reasonable. The setting is more quiet and on the classy side. Would definitely recommend this place if you're in FiDi and looking for a cool wine bar (it's smack dab next to Union Square).
author: Tony M.

description: I know it's probably a tourist place to go... but I still like it to grab some tastes of wine and a light bite.  I've been here a few times and always enjoy myself.  I don't know where all the other great wine bars are in San Francisco, because I've only been a tourist... but this always satisfies and has great and very knowledgeable waiters.
author: Shara G.

description:
This place is great!!!

I'm not a huge wine person.  But after all the seedy bars and over priced cocktails in the city we decided to check out a few wine bars.  We stumbled upon this place and it was just a great overall experience.  The interior was extremely inviting and cozy.  It looked as if it may have just been updated.  The staff was knowledgeable and very friendly.  The wine selection was good and they had a bunch of cheese and chocolate flights to match if you're into pairing.  Overall, just a really comfortable nice spot to enjoy a couple glasses.
author: Eddie T.

description:
This spot just opened with advertisement or announcement - one day the doors were just unlocked.  I checked it out with my fiance and some friends on a Friday night and we were able to get a seat right away at a table near the fireplace.  The ambiance is spot on - a great mix of elegant and interesting with comfortable chairs, great upholstery, interesting textural wall art, and awesome lighting.  Its intimate enough for a date, but chill enough for friends or coworkers. 

While it just opened, the staff was great and have clearly already gotten all the kinks worked out.  They offer wines by the bottle and glass, as well as curated wine flights (cheese and chocolate flights too!).  The waiters give you a written info card with each flight so you can actually learn a bit about what you are consuming, as well as telling you a bit about the wines.  

No complaints here -  I will definitely come back.
author: Virginia B.

description:
Woes of an American Ex-Pat part 3:

Wine. I know. There is amazing wine in Europe. But it's not the same as California wine. They are both good in their own right, and living in the UK means we don't get good Californian wine. Or we have to pay ridiculously for it. So when we're in the states, we make an effort to try to drink a lot of wine.

Eno Wine Bar really helped with this. We came in after finishing our Christmas shopping on a Wednesday afternoon. And we stayed way too long. They offer a variety of interesting (and interestingly named) wine flights with a variety of wines to try on them. And wine flights aren't as common in the UK it seems, so it's nice to have a chance to try a lot of wines while we're around. We did gravitate toward the California selections, but they have a great selection of European wines as well.

But, not only do they do wine and have an interesting selection of it, they do cheese flights as well. Usually cheese plates are a selection of different cheeses. But at Eno they seem to do a selection of similar cheeses for you to try with a certain type of wine or wine flight. A cheese flight with a wine flight. it's a brilliant idea. They also serve a bit of other food, the duck bruschetta had us intrigued, but since we had a big breakfast and was meeting a friend for dinner we stuck to the cheese.

The service is great too. Of course, it was fairly empty when we were there, but the general manager was chatting with us about wine. Of course it helps that the other half throws his wine knowledge around, but it's seem to impress people on several occasions. Plus being able to talk about Chateau Musar was also a bonus.

It's also nice because it's right off Union Square but is fairly low on the pretension scale. So if we're back in SF, we'll be heading here again.
author: Grant T.

description:
What a great modern wine bar in Union square! It's always exciting to have another wine bar in town. Excellent selection of domestic and international wines. Comfortable and inviting ambiance. Sat in the back room by the fireplace. Service was stellar and pleasant. 

We stopped in around 2ish; by the time we left the work crowd started funneling in. Will definitely make it back soon!
author: Maria C.

description: Taster experience option was great, good wine we had the "decade club flight", nice  atmosphere.
author: John A.

description:
A cozy lounge amidst the bustle of Union Square. You've probably walked past it many times and never noticed it. 

I rarely drink so the fact that I enjoyed a particular wine (the Moscato) stood out. 

Also ordered the Bruschetta flights - liked all but the Duck Prosciutto.

Recommend for 1:1 or small group conversations, though it can comfortably accommodate at least two groups of 8.
author: An Y.

description: We stopped in on our first day in the city. Had the meat/cheese plate, a flatbread pizza and a wine flight. Everything was wonderful. Our server was very kind and gave us great recommendations for things to do!
author: JB D.
