description: This place was quite cozy-feeling and cute. I enjoyed the options for wine flights, glasses, and foods. I thought the service was quite slow for a weekday night (with not all the tables filled) and the wine flight explanation a bit dull. The flatbreads were delicious, though!
author: Mary N.

description: Really good and enjoyed the variety. We had an olive tapenade a cheese flight and red wine flight. Loved atmosphere and set up
author: Shelley B.

description: Walked around for almost a hour in search of a good dinner spot.i was still full from the pho I ate earlier so Eno happened to b the perfect place. Passed by and saw the fire place, couches and dark ambiance. Couldn't help but walk in. Wonderful wine olives and charcuterie.very pleased.
author: Liz D.

description: Words can not explain how amazing this place is!!!  First place that I stopped at in san Francisco.  I fell in LOVE.  Completely and utterly relaxed.  I enjoyed 2 glasses of white wine and enjoyed a cheese platter.  I was with my honey so the ambiance was romantic, intimate, and casual.  The waitress was absolutely lovely and most of all, she did not try to sell us super $$$ wine.  We stayed on the conservative $15-$20 glass of wine.  I honestly loved this place and seeing that there's a location in san Diego makes it all that better! If I am ever in the san Francisco area I will definitely be making a trip to this cute little spot.
author: Angelica C.

description: Stormy and I really enjoyed this place. They had a good variety of wines to sample and Alex is a jewel. He knows his stuff. He just doesn't come off as tall in person as he sounds. Management should definitely give them a raise.
author: Duane H.

description: Stopped by with my wife and found a nice table - on a Friday at 7pm!!  Great atmosphere, nice and pretty quiet so you hear yourself talk.  Our waiter was very friendly and very helpful while discussing wines.  We each had a flight of wines that were all fantastic.  I would definitely go back to Eno and would recommend it to anyone in the area.
author: Alfredo V.

description: I loved this place!  As I walked by, it drew me in.  The ambiance and decor are great.  They have very interesting art including the wine bottle wall.  I sat at a table by the fireplace....perfect!  I enjoyed two wonderful glasses of Meteor cabernet.  The service was excellent and friendly; they really made me feel welcome.  I can't wait to go back!!!
author: Valerie F.

description: great selection of wines, groovy appetizers.........service needs work. The quality needs to be consistant. Get on off some coin and hire a better class of waitress
author: tony n.

description:
I'm liking this one! Interesting selection of wines and flights. I'm not a wine connoisseur, but appreciate good wines! I liked how they paired them as well. 

A good selection of eats too. Nibbles and more substantial dishes. 

Good place to go for intimate conversations over good wine and food!
author: Leslie E.

description:
i love this cute little wine bar.  pretty good selection of wine.  what i like most is the service.  the staff here are nice and knowledgeable --- I LIKE!!!  

I have been here a few times already, and I see myself continue to be a loyal patron :)
author: Cintia S.

description: Cute wine bar. Comfortable seats that make you want to stay for a long time. Great service. Waitress made great suggestions for wine. We ordered the mix cheese, meat and chocolate plate, I think it was called the Eno Experience, delicious.
author: Tammy S.

description: I don't know what the big deal was. It was expensive , wine was blah, ambiance and service were good but nothing to rave about. Maybe my expectations were to high. There are so many other great spots. I say skip it.
author: annie n.

description: It was well overall. Waitress not so good, pretty rude actually. They say they close at midnight but last call for wine was at 10pm.
author: Liliana R.

description: This was an amazing experience.  We chose the combo Enu experience and then added to it after we realized how exceptional the wine and cheeses are. Stop in, you will not be disappointed.
author: Shauna N.

description: Great wines and yummy cheese plates! Place is a little pricey.. But it's Union Square in SF.. So normal
author: Gabe W.

description: Seriously the best deviled eggs I've ever had!!  They are an absolute must!!  Make sure you get the mixed flight of them!
author: Christina H.

description: Great atmosphere and decor. Really was drawn to its open window and set up before coming there tonight. But when I got there and sat down at one of the comfy Seats by the window with my fiancée, it was definitely worth it!!! Great selection of flights and eatables. The only only small thing I would say I wish they had was if you could crest your won flight of wine but I can understand that being difficult bc the flights coming with notecards of info for each glass! Would definitely recommend it and go back to when in town! And great date/post dinner spot!
author: Avi S.

description: Great wine selection and very friendly staff! Great charcuterie board but I wish they had a broader bites selection. Overall - great little spot!
author: kiersten a.

description: Wine. Cheese. Chocolate: My three favorite things..how could I not love this place?
author: Rachelle Q.

description: This spot is such a treat! Came here late night with friends from out of town and it was the perfect place for us to catch up and relax. Wine and food selection is awesome and the staff is super helpful and knowledgable. Even though it was late on a random Monday night, we weren't rushed out and really enjoyed the ambiance. We loved it! Will definitely be back!
author: Gina L.

description: Came here to grab a nice bottle to take back to our hotel and a cheese tray. Service was amazing and so was the wine! I wish we had enough time to come back and spend an evening here. Highly recommend!
author: Danielle R.

description:
I was heading up a scavenger hunt for my department as a close to our VMWorld week and needed a great, fun place to end the hunt. I was super lucky to yelp "fun, hip bar in union square" and ENO Wine Bar came up!

Absentmindedly I forgot to call ahead and warn them to expect about 28 of us showing up. To my surprise, when I finally arrived half my team was already being helped to wine, beer and tasty treats! They welcomed us all with warm open arms, great wines and beers and like I said tasty treats. The fact that we gave them no notice, the atmosphere was awesome, they still took care of every other customer that walked in off the street while still making everyone feel like we were all the only ones in the place.

The service is top notch and they actually really care about every person that walks through the door. I would definitely be back with a small group, date night or again with a large group. Thank you ENO for being part of the great experience that my entire group took away that day!
author: AG G.

description: Warm and welcoming staff in this very cool and comfy place just off onion square. A wonderful respite from the energy of the streets in the area. Great staff recommendations on excellent wine and delightful snacks to accompany it.
author: B D.

description: Very good service. Great wine, enjoyed Italian an Washington Rose. Beautiful interior and premium location. Perfect spot for a glass of wine after long day at work.
author: Kseniya S.

description: We had an amazing cheese plate with fantastic wine that paired brilliantly. The ambience was superb. We felt the price point was fair as well given the quality of the wines and cheeses. Would definitely return!
author: Michelle M.

description: Great wine, great snacks and great service!  A hidden gem in the bustling union square area. Definitely stop by for a great experience!
author: Maggie W.

description: The opened at 2, even though their phone recording said 12. They had ONE server for the entire bar. ONE. She told us she understood if we left. We did. The menu looked weak but the wine list seemed ok. This place could have made so much as it was the day after Christmas and the area was full of people. Get your act together.
author: Heath H.

description: Nice place. Came in for a drink after work - not bad. Good wine selection and flatbread. No happy hour specials. We sat in the back room which was nice albeit a bit quiet. We were being loud and chatty and I was afraid of interrupting folks. Oh well. I'll likely be back.
author: Melinda C.

description: This wine bar is a great place for a romantic or quiet time with friends.  The ambiance was more intimate with a fireplace warming the room.  This place knows wine.  The wine flights my wife and I had were well-priced and good choices for the flights.  I found the staff knowledgable of wine and its pairings.  The food offerings were all good choices and priced reasonably for San Francisco. A good location and value in the city.
author: Roger H.

description: Fantastic experience.  My wife and I popped in after a busy week night in the ciry and were looking for a relaxing break from the busy day. Our waiter Jat on was extremely knowledgeable with a great sense of humor.  We enjoyed two flights of wine with a flight of dark chocolate.  The Claret was superb. A must stop next time is San Francisco.
author: Rich G.

description: Don't go to this place I went in to buy a large amount on a gift card we are talking $$$ and the girl there "I DON'T KNOW HOW TO DO THAT " Umm really you work here right ?? She goes to find out and proceeds to wait on other people . So I asked her do you even them ?? Again " I don't  know "  then she tells me I will ask my boss are you in the area  for awhile ? To wait till he gets back to me ?? Ummm NO I can't wait to find out if they even get back to you. You work here right this is your job and you don't know how to do it . NICE TELL YOUR BOSS YOU LOST A 500 $ PURCHASE on your shift and any future business cause you Don't know how to do your Job NO STARS
author: Gayle S.

description: I liked this place, but there are better options out there! I came here for my birthday with my boyfriend and we had a nice time - but we have enjoyed other places more. The cheese plate here was a bit sparse, the bread was stale, and the service wasn't exactly friendly. Maybe we came on a bad day. The wine was good though, and the atmosphere was nice as well. I'd choose other places before this one, but if you're close by it's an okay option.
author: Petrea R.

description: Very cozy and quaint! Walked right by this place at first but did see the words- wine, cheese, and chocolate on the dark windows. After walking down the entire street to find a bar to go to in the middle of the day, my girl friend and I decided to walk back down and grab a glass of wine. The idea of one glass of wine turned into the Eno Experience and an additional glass of wine. The Eno Experience is 3 cheeses, 3 meats, 1 piece of chocolate and 1 glass of wine. Easily shareable between two people. The experience was fun, loved sitting by the window and people watching. What better place to do so then the center of San Francisco?! Would definitely recommend this place and would certainly love to go back. Maybe next time I'll opt for some bruschetta and try a wine flight :)
author: Juri M.

description: Tried this place out for the second time and YUM! Still impressed. My coworkers and I totally enjoyed this cozy wine bar. We shared a delicious bottle of wine and finished it off with this chocolate plate that was everything!!! Turns out my coworker forgot her MacBook there and when she went back the next day they had it waiting there for her! It's really nice to have a near by spot with a trust worthy staff to kick back and enjoy the evening. Thanks eno!!
author: Michelle D.

description: My new go-to wine bar. Love the presentation and ambience, from the people watching seats at the windows to the cozy fireplace. The small food plates are generous (try one of the cheese flights) and well paired with the wine selections. Wines are frequently changing, so inquire about what's new! oh, and if you need a taste to narrow down your preference, well, just ask. Love this place!
author: Ali G.

description:
My husband and I went here to have some drinks for our anniversary, and it was crap. The blonde woman with the huge hipster glasses started to take our order then disappeared for a pretty long time. The younger fella then stepped in and took our order and explained to us what everything was since we are not huge winos. We noticed too that woman started helping other tables right before she vanished, so we were not the only people with the "where'd that lady go?" thought. The prices are okay, the location is noisy,  but it's union square so you can't really help that. You can tell that this place is not for people who aren't up to speed on what's what in the wine world. 

So yeah, tall skinny guy, you were cool and very helpfull, but that woman kinda ruined the whole thing. Probably not ever going back here.
author: Liz F.

description: I've walked by this place many times and finally went in for a glass of wine with a friend.  Nice selection of wines and cheeses and good for people watching in Union square
author: Lisa B.

description: Great exp with fantastic wine and good food. Would have preferred the portions to be bigger and more veg/ fruit options. Service could improve a notch but good experience in all.
author: Pooja S.

description: Excellent, non pretentious wine bar next to the st. Francis. Great selection of wine and cheese and very knowledgeable
author: Kate G.

description: Lovely wine bar, beautifully and simply decorated. Gregg helped us, guided our selections, and told us about the wine industry. Totally enjoyed the experience here. Had a fabulous Teira Sauvignon Blanc, cheese plate and a flatbread. Would absolutely come back. They have a nice fireplace - it is very good wherever you sit. Enjoy. Location is great in the Union Square theatre district.
author: Rhonda S.

description: Great ambiance! Decided to drop by as I was walking by, attracted by the prospect of wine and cheese flights. Who would have thought my fiancé and I would have such a great time? They have flights for bubbly, reds whites and sweet wines. And 4 or 5 cheese flights too. And the quality? Fantastic. Will definitely try to come regularly.
author: Leo G.

description: Well educated very nice servers and host. Great atmosphere. A bit pricey but its top tier wine and incredible chocolate. Definitely a place to go if your into wine or dark chocolate.
author: Michael C.

description:
Nice place!  Found it while hanging out in Union Square.  We were met by our gracious host, who sat us down next to the fire place.  It was quiet, but quickly became very busy.  The customers all seemed very pleasant and a really good energy in the place.  

Server was busy, which we completely excused as they seemed to be a little short staffed.  No problem.

The wine flight preparation was excellent with the description cards facing you so you could read along as you drank.  While people may not care much about this, I found the placement and marketing of the wooden plank, and the white note cards to be PERFECTLY placed, plus if you liked a wine, you could perforate one of the cards and stick it in your wallet and it's now a wine reference card, and their business card.  Marketing genius!

Nice music.

Why did I not give it 5 stars???   The wine.  The wine was fine, but not fantastic or overly notable. 

Looking forward to seeing Eno Wine Bar grow into a blazing success!
author: Todd A.

description: First wine bar I ever went to in the city and I really enjoyed it. I like sitting by the window and people watching. The wine is good and the food is too! The atmosphere is cozy and intimate. All around great place!
author: Brittini S.

description: Extremely romantic, small scale wine bar. Me and my wife had some delicious wine pairings and also sat close to the fireplace. This is definitely one of my favorites!
author: Barrett S.

description:
After a day of busy shopping in union square we wanted to rest our feet and relax with a glass of wine. We randomly passed by the bar and decided to go in- best decision ever! 
It's a great place to unwind and meet up with old friends over a few glasses of wine, our waiter was very knowledgeable and able to steer us through their menu, their selection is really good! He gave us a few tasters and totally changed my mind about zinfandel's- wine which I usually stay far away from. 
It's not overcrowded and noisy  like most of the bars in the area and you can get comfortable seating. Great wine, good conversation with old friends, fantastic location, Fabulous ambiance- easily 5 stars.
author: Sahana B.

description: Great ambience.  I loved sitting next to the fireplace in the back.  The wine was amazing.  I would definitely go here on a date or rainy day to enjoy some delicious wine with a friend.
author: Polly P.

description: Had a delicious tasting of volcanic reds. Lovely esp the obscure canary island wine. Didn't try food. Good location right off of union square
author: N. B.

description: The service is excellent even with our large, loud group. All the ladies were knowledgeable and helpful with the wine selection. It is very good customer service to ask what price range you want your wine to be. Ordering bottles can be intimidating and I appreciated the servers taking their time to go through different profiles of wine within my budget. Definitely coming back.
author: Manu M.

description: I came here late in the evening after an event in San Francisco, and was looking for a snack/appetizer. I didn't order wine, so I can't comment on the wine quality. But the appetizers and ambience were great. The deviled eggs were fantastic--they came in four varieties, and were very delicious. One of them came with salmon roe. The chacuterie plate was ok. The ambience was nice: it was quiet there, a good spot to escape from the noisy and busy downtown area while being in the midst of it.
author: P H.

description: Always love this place. Unique nibbles: different types of deviled eggs. Nice change for those of us not partaking in bread and crackers, LOVE the wine flights from Urban Wine Makers and locals. Great atmosphere and the service is excellent!
author: Kimberly R.

description: Super cute atmosphere,  nice wine flights and delicious chocolate.  Pricey for sure but nothing unexpected
author: Stacy A.

description: Great place! The wine flights are great and the staff is really nice! Got the spanish wine flight and the urban legends wine flight! Also got the chocolate truffle flight which was so good!! Great time and pretty inexpensive! :)
author: Livvy B.

description: Beautiful place. Wonderful wine flights and super helpful staff. Totally worth the visit.
author: Martina Z.

description: Wasn't too impressed with this place, but I did come right as they were opening and on a slow day. Most of the food wasn't available and when the kitchen did open, half of the menu was still unavailable. The wine list is pretty cool though, but the service was a little slow. From reading other reviews, I'll definitely have to come back during the evening!
author: Sheeva G.

description: This place is super cute! The lights behind the wall of wine were sparkly and amazing. I felt very chic being there. The age range went from 20-60. It was lovely to be surrounded by everyone who seemed to be 100% enjoying themselves and their company. I think it helped that most folks had 2-3 glasses each in front of them. I guess that means everyone really loved the wine! I tried their moscato fell in love. Had it not been a work night I would have ordered an entire bottle. It's sweet, but not in a horrible way. I will definitely be coming back.
author: Julia A.

description: Want a great glass of vino tonight? Look no further than Eno. Best hospitality in SF. Doesn't matter who takes case of you - Joel, Steve, Jay, Erica, Alex. This is a fun neighborhood wine bar, even though you'll hear a bunch of tourist talk due to where it's situated under the Westin St. Francis.
author: Kathryn P.

description: Great place to visit after shopping in Union Square. The wine flights are great - love the 100 year old vine option. The deviled eggs with Duck Confit are amazing and so is the grilled cheese. I love this place!
author: paula g.

description: Pricey but I wouldn't mind going back. We ordered the chocolate sundae and there were only 3 chocolates for $11 but the raspberry chocolate was delicious. Very chocolaty and went well with our red wine. The waiter gave me an extra raspberry chocolate at the end. Overall, lighting and ambience was cozY. Had a fireplace and bathroom was against a wall. Can't tell it was a bathroom. We sat near the big window and I thought it was romantic. Oh, wines are pricey because they are made in early 2000. Grapes were better then.
author: Elms M.

description: The location, wine flights, and cheese plates were perfect for a chill Saturday night near Union Square but I'm having to knock down my rating to 3 stars simply due to the service. Our waitress just didn't seem to want to be there and didn't smile at all. Everything was in place to make this a fantastic experience but it turned out to be just OK due to the downer vibe from the server.
author: Carlton H.

description: Service was slow at first but improved. Great selection of wines and cheeses. Server was very knowledgeable about the menu and wine options. Chill atmosphere for drinking wine and chatting.
author: Jennifer S.

description: My friend introduced me to ENO wine bar, and my experience was awesome.  The servers are very chill and friendly, not snubbish or pretentious.  Its okay to admit that you have no clue about wine, they explain everything to you and make sure you are satisfied with your wine.  They have so many wine flights to choose from that its a little overwhelming.  I suggest telling your server what kind of wine you are into and they will pick something that suites your taste buds.  They also have cheese and chocolate pairings, the chocolate truffles are amazing!  This is definitely a great spot to meet friends, they have food, wine, and a great low keyed atmosphere.  I will definitely be back!
author: Terence N.

description: Got a cheese and wine flight. Food and wine was ok. Had to fill up my own water glass twice. Had my card on the table ready to pay my bill for 20 min with no service. Not fun.
author: Cara V.

description: We truly enjoyed Eno! Great atmosphere with a wonderful selection of wines, cheeses and dessert. Our server was very knowledgable and  helpful. I selected the West Coast Wonders flight of reds. It was a good value for $18.00 with generous pours. I enjoyed all three! We paired with the bruschetta which was wonderful. Quiet enough for a date yet also has couches and tables to accommodate a small group. Highly recommended!
author: lori l.

description: Okay so I would give this place 4 stars because my sisters and I got 3 chocolates for nearly 20 bucks, BUT, you don't pay for only the chocolates, right? It's the ambiance! And the wine wall and the table when you walk it opens up and it's cool and modern and the fleets are just so cute it almost doesn't matter about over priced chocolate! Plus you knew what you were getting into when you came in. 5 stars. Worth it.
author: Nolis E.

description: I will start by quoting the great Steve Martin. "All I can say is WOW!" This place is the complete package. Very nice ambiance and décor. Great wine and excellent food choices to go with it. Friendly and attentive staff. This is a new favorite spot of ours in the downtown area. We will be back for sure.
author: Adam K.

description: What a cool little place. just recently opened , understandably not very busy, which is a good thing. Wine selection is great, servers are very helpful. simple and slick at the same time. My date was very impressed.
author: Diana K.

description: Recently visited Eno for wine tasting before a show at the Curran. Large number of diverse wine selections, including 300 by the bottle (half under $50) and close to 50 wines by the glass (starting at $9). Really enjoyed our two flights of wine along with a delicious cheese pairing. Excellent service with a waiter who was knowledgeable about wine & make helpful suggestions. Fun place with great atmosphere to savor and swirl! Can't wait to go back when we're in the neighborhood & maybe we'll even be lucky enough to hit Happy Hour.
author: HJ B.

description: Modern decor with a touch of sophistication but not pretentious.  Friendly knowledgeable stuff.  Tasty bites.   Good location.  Wine flights could be a bit pricey, but $30 wine bottles on sale they are trying to get rid of are a steal.
author: Slava L.

description: Fab location, amazing staff, and nectar of the gods. Perfect for afternoon wine tasting.
author: Shan B.

description: Very cool ambiance with delicious (and awesomely named) flights and knowledgeable staff.  Would be a great place to bring a date or just hang out and chill with friends.   Definitely coming back.
author: Chung Y.

description: The place was cute. Considering it wasn't busy, the service was inattentive. I can't really comment on the food as we only ordered wine and cheese.
author: Sharon C.

description: This place just opened to little fanfare in Union Square. We went on a Friday night, fairly early, and were able to sit down quickly and easily. The atmosphere was relaxed, comfy, and friendly, but still quite upscale. All the servers were really nice and helpful, not intrusive, and very knowledgeable. Pretty much exactly what you want in a wine bar staff. And - the most important part - the wine was great. All the flights were well thought out and interesting, and each came with a detailed explanation of the wines in it. I had the "Float Like a Butterfly, Sting Like a Bee" flight, and it ranged from the mineral-ly (wine from the Italian volcanic slopes of Sicily) to the spicy (something that I can't remember). Really good. The charcuterie platter was also particularly good. Would return.
author: Michael B.

description: Welcome to the neighborhood! I was happy to find Steve (formerly Savvy Cellars, Mtn View) taking care of us and the wine list. He and their team have constructed an interesting and eclectic menu of nibbles and wines. It's nice to have our local palates challenged with their international selection of wine and extended with their ginger beer. We really enjoyed the bruschetta flight and the mixed chocolate plate Steve put together for us. Soon they will have light foods in addition to the charcuterie and cheese plates. Locals and tourists will find a welcome respite from the busy Union Square vibe just outside.
author: Mark H.

description: Second time here. Food plates are delish. Wine is even better. Chill atmosphere, nice servers and good people watching outside. Stop in for a quick bite and a tasty glass of wine! Be aware that prices are a little steep per glass, but it is definitely worth it.
author: Christin M.

description: If you want to find a nice relaxing place to catch up with friends, this place is great.  We went on a Saturday, around 4:30.  We were easily able to find a table near the fireplace and catch up with our buddies.  Wines are good.  Deviled eggs were delicious!  Try the Truffle Charcuterie.  YUM!!!!
author: Nutmeg Y.

description: Stumbled across Eno last night with a friend who was visiting from out of town. Very impressive. We tried a few of the wine flights, and also knocked out a cheese plate, a chocolate plate, and a couple of sandwiches. Everything was amazing, and the service was perfect (super friendly, very knowledgeable). I'll definitely be stopping in here again.
author: Pat M.

description: The cheese plate was amazing! One of the best i have had. The flights were great too. Our waiter let us sub out a few wines on the flights. Great service!
author: Carly F.

description:
cute little place right in the middle of the bustle of union sq but it has a great ambiance to catch up with friends or go on a date

my girlfriends and I got a couple of wines off of their huge list 
duck confit sandwich -- 3/5 stars
bruschetta -- my friends shared the sampler 4/5

i will be back for some reunions
author: Janet Y.

description: Good place to stop in if you are in Union Square. Located under the Westin St. Francis, Eno offers a variety of wines and some food items. I tried the Pinot Evil wine flight which was delicious. They have a few flights to choose from as well as by the glass and bottles. Food was cheese flights, some sandwiches and salads and a few other items. Typical wine bar food.
author: Aneilia M.

description: Nice wine menu combined with good service - a place to drop in and have a drink. The cheese selection was fine
author: Johanna G.

description: Friendly and knowledgable staff made us feel welcome from the get go. Great range of wines and loads of food suitable for sharing available. Sit down and watch the world go by or enjoy with friends. Highly recommended.
author: John B.

description: Loved this place!! Great selection of wines which paired great with our cheese flight. We were able to create our own flight of cheeses; the only drawback was too many yummy choices of cheese. Service was great as well. This place is perfect for a date night or a girls catch up session. I will definitely come back soon.
author: Michelle B.

description: I went last night and really enjoyed my visit. I tried a flight to get a taste of what they had to offer and then went off the suggestions of the staff for a glass or two. All of the wines were awesome and the staff was knowledgeable. Pick a seat by the window and people watch while you sip. I had the bruschetta sampler and thought it was delicious. It's a great spot to sit and talk. Loved it!
author: Alicia H.

description: My husband and I were looking for an after dinner drink before heading to the hotel, and this place was a great find. Nice cozy atmosphere. The lady that helped us knew her wine really well and had very good suggestions. It was the perfect ending to our night! You should check it out!
author: Carol S.

description: Amazing wines. Amazing prices. Amazing cheeses. Get the triple by pass cheese board. And they can make it gluten free! Yeeeeee! Love this place. We go whenever we are in union square area.
author: Rachel W.

description: I rarely give out 5 stars but my experience at Eno truly deserves a 5 star rating. I went in with the intention of having a Pre-dinner drink...1 flight, 1 glass of sparkling (plus a healthy sampling of my dinner companions flight), 2 cheese trios, truffle drizzled salami, and a chocolate trio later and I decided dinner was no longer required and opted for a sing along piano bar instead. Oh my!  Shout out to our awesome waiter as well...who's name I unfortunately have forgotten. His knowledge and enthusiasm helped ensure the 5 star rating.
author: Kathy S.

description: nice atmosphere, pretty good flights.  vegan snack options very limited, waiter was a little flaky but accommodating.
author: Coco J.

description: Hidden Gem!  We stumbled in here on a lark and were really impressed with the staff and the treats.  Admittedly we only did a champagne flight and chocolate tasting but both were really yummy.  The place has a nice cozy feel and I am looking forward to a return trip to try other menu options and more wine.
author: Melissa G.

description: I was around the area and looking for a place for a drink before catching my flight and ended up at Eno and it did not disappoint. Modern feel, love the furniture and decor and fantastic service. The waiters were extremely knowledgeable and helpful in my dilemma of what to order. Good location and it wasn't busy at all on a Thursday night, which can be a good or bad thing. If you're in the area and looking for a place to chat over a glass of wine, I'd highly recommend this place.
author: Rick K.

description: Great cozy wine bar with reasonable flights of wine.  Our server was knowledge, energetic and friendly.  I was worried this place would feel pretentious but instead it was casual and made me feel at home.  Would definitely return!
author: Adrian K.

description: This is our 3rd consecutive year in San Francisco over Thanksgiving and have always looked for a nice wine bar. This place has a excellent location just a few steps from Union Square and is very modern and personal inside. The staff was excellent, wine selection fantastic and the cheese flights tasty. Highly recommend this place, we are skipping dinner tonight and going here instead. A average bottle and 2 cheese flights with tip will run you about $120.
author: John S.

description: I think I learned more about wine here than any other wine tour I've been on. Ordered the sparkling wine and mixed flights with a perfect pair of cheese and bread. GreAt knowledgeable and friendly service. Will definitely come back another time!
author: Sovanna P.

description: What a great unexpected find! Fun flights, fireplace, cool seating, impressive service.
author: Vicki L.

description: I ran in to grab wine and cheese to bring to a friends house for dinner. They were very friendly in helping me pick out a wine and packed up bread, jams and nuts with the wine. If you are staying at the Westin St. Francis this place is literally right next door and looks very cute for a post work drink.
author: Alicia M.

description:
Great place to stop and sip some wine and sample some light food. 

Great service and ambiance.  Two nights we arrived within an hour of closing and they welcomed without any problems (even after they had pretty much gone through most of their cheese following a private tasting earlier). 

Amazing wine and cheese recommendations, and the chocolate flights were perfectly paired. 

If you're lucky, you can grab the table in front of the fireplace..very romantic. If not window seats or the relaxing lounge area in the middle is a great place to hang with friends. 
Perfect pit stop between shopping, or a late dinner.

I will definitely put this on my list of things to do every time I visit the city, besides the owner is from Fresno too.
author: Craig R.

description: I stumbled in and out of this place everynight I was in SF. I had a Pinot Noir from Germany, Yes Germany that changed my life. The crostini with the duck is yummy.  The only thing I did not have was dessert wine. That will be the first thing I do On my return. The people who work there are so friendly and engaging and know there stuff about wine.
author: Carmen D.

description: My boyfriend and I were visiting from North Carolina and discovered this fantastic wine bar just outside of our hotel. The intimate atmosphere, delicious snacks, and wine selection brought us here multiple times during our stay. A special thank you to Besilio for introducing us to our new favorite bubbly! He's like a walking wine encyclopedia. The rest of the staff is wonderful, too. We will definitely be stopping by the next time we're in San Francisco!
author: Kristin B.

description: romantic night with the husband was fulfilled at this wine bar. we both had flights and cheese. YUM. the staff knew their stuff and was accommodating. we def will be back!
author: karina p.

description: Cute place! Perfect for a break from Union Square shopping. I like that the wine list is so varied, none of the Usual Suspects, which is refreshing. I was impressed that 2/3 wines in my flight, I repurchased when I got home. They have a small selection of snacks, but I think they are a bit over-priced. Definately will return. Tip: try to get the table for 2 by the fireplace. Nice touch.
author: Jen S.

description: Excellent selection of wines for the wine flights.  We were looking to taste local wines from the US and the wine flights did just that.  Great and knowledgeable service with excellent wines.  The olives are great.
author: Luke B.

description: So I was snooty and prejudged based on the fact that this place is a chain and right in the heart of union square.  I was WRONG. (sorry). Relatively intimate without feeling like your sitting in someone other than your dates lap, great selection and nice servers. Bonus, not crazy crowded, not much of a scene, which works for me.
author: Poppy C.

description: Nice little wine bar in Union Square.  A bit overpriced, but it's Union Square.  I got a wine flight and a cheese flight.  It was good, but didn't knock my socks off.  However, if I had to spend time in Union Square again, I'd go back.
author: Jordana M.

description: Delicious wine and food. Great service. Cozy, yet at the same time, "hip", atmosphere. Fun place to go with friends or sit alone and people watch out the window at the diverse group of people going up and down Geary.
author: Julie K.

description: Pretty reasonable prices. Great and knowledgeable service. Very impressed with everything. My wife and I loved it. If you stop by I don't think you'll be disappointed.
author: Eric G.

description: Great little place off Union Square. We ordered a wine flight and a chocolate flight. The chocolate flight was 3 truffles (tiny pieces) but delicious. The wine was great - it was their featured winery's flight. The server was knowledgeable and friendly and seemed to be attentive to all guests. The location is great and the price was what can be expected at a place so close to Union Square. The selection was really good too, however I would have liked to see more Central Coast representation. The decor was also very nice and it was a bit of a sanctuary with a window view of the madness of Union Square. At one point a passerby stopped to brush her hair in our window, never knowing she was a third party to our wine tasting. I would definitely go back.
author: Dan U.

description: To say amazing service doesn't do this place justice. It was above that. Great wine, great ambiance. If your thinking about going, GO. You won't be disappointed. Ask Joel, the wine director what's good. He knows his stuff.
author: Scott R.

description: The food is good, the wine is great, and the service is excellent. Check out the featured wine flight, they pick interesting wines. Erica (my server) was attentive, informative, and friendly. She really made my visit a great experience!
author: Andrea W.

description:
We happened upon a small chocolate, cheese and wine bar as we walked along
geary street looking for a deli place where we could eat something delicious without
feeling over-fed. We, two women in our 70s & obvious tourists, assumed that this
space might be too high-end for us but we ventured in anyway.

Lucky day!  Absolutely no snobbishness--just motivation to present their products
with the intention to serve, inform and most of all to please.

The attractive young woman who helped us was so helpful in choosing the right
cheeses for each of us and knew instinctively that we were novices. I had the most
delicious --mellow, I suggested when she asked what taste I preferred-- Wisconsin
cheese (Pleasant Ridge Reserve/ Cow) while my friend had a more pungent and
saltier goat cheese.  This was all accompanied with quince, grapes and nuts, and
bread.  What could have been more satisfying??

And all of this within our means.  Recommend this place whole-heartedly and I
intend (on any subsequent return to SF) to enjoy Eno again.

Wish I had asked for our server's name.
author: Yeiko N.

description: Saw this place back in March but didn't have time to check it out. Got to check it out this weekend with my sister and we had a great time there with Alex as our waiter. The food offerings were delicious and paired perfectly with the wines we were suggested. I hope more people will check this place out.
author: Catherine M.

description:
We saw the reviews on yelp and tried this out. We were definitely older than most of the people here tonight and it had a really nice atmosphere and the staff are amazingly friendly and knowledgeable. The eno special combination of charcuterie and cheeses are really nice. Of course as a European, I don't mind small portions and would rather have high quality than quantity, but the chocolates were a little sparse for 11$, very special but not quite enough.
The wines were well chosen and had a good balance and evolution to them.
I definitely hope to come back when we go back into the city.
author: Susan H.

description: What a fantastic space! Their wine selection is excellent. Their wine flights offer a great variety of tastes. We ended up taking home 4 bottles of the 6 wines we  tasted. Great place!
author: Johannes L.

description: I'm in this area quite a bit and never noticed this wine bar until a friend found it by accident. It's a nice refuge from the crowds around union square as it was peaceful and relaxing and I met a friend there mid-afternoon. I was recently in Mendoza, AR so I tested the owner's knowledge of Malbecs and he passed with flying colors! Wines are reasonably priced for SF. Had some marcona almonds to accompany my wine. Will be back again, now that I know about it! Very convenient place when you want a break from shopping and don't want to drink wine in a mall setting.
author: Cathy P.

description: Awesome wine bar in Union Square! Great price points on wine's by the glass and fantastic service!
author: James B.

description: Stopped by this place after dinner for a wine flight. I was surprised at the list as there were not very many familiar names - I didn't recognize a lot of the vineyards. The best part about the place is the people watching and view - it is a nice haven away from the union square craziness but it would have been nice to see some more California selections. I'll come back - especially if needed a shopping break - but I wouldn't go out of my way.
author: Alison D.

description: Ok, we were visiting and looking for a place to relax and enjoy some good wine.........we found exactly what we were looking for with a bonus.....the day before we had spend the day in Napa and the experience was continued with knowledgable staff and a great environment. We had the bonus of having some great cheese paired with our wine that made our evening.  We are from Virginia and wished we had a few places like this back home. Support this local business and you will have a gem for years to come.
author: Donald G.

description: The place was solid from when we walked in, bathroom was very clean, whole place was modern and sleek. Was surpised there was no bar to sit at once we walked in but loved window setting, the place is big with plenty of cool spots to people watch, along with couches and a fire place in the back which made it a very cool and inviting atmosphere. We had ordered the Go Green or Go Home Flight, all organic, all perfect. After tasting the flight I chose the first glass and my girlfriend preferred the second out of the three. We were in a hurry as we were on our way to a art show but glanced at the food which I believe was cool because they also offered flights of cheese, bruschetta , and meats, which we will definitely be back to try. Upon leaving we noticed chocolate and instantly assumed they were from Cocoa Bella, but our server explained that the chocolates were from other local venders, which seemed just as good. I will definitely be back in regards to the wine, food, hors d'oeuvres, ambiance, style, and of course the acknowledgeable customer service!
author: Manuel H.

description: Wonderful new wine bar in a stellar location!  We were out with friends and the manager (maybe the owner) Joel used to work at Savvy in Mountain View.  We popped in and had a great time.  Strong variety of unique wines and the flight selections are creative and clever.  The light food offerings were a great pairing with everything.  We waitied longer then usual for our second order of bruschetta - but it was definitely worth the wait.  Definitely worth stopping in and trying something new...or even a glass of an old favorite.
author: Trista A.

description: excellent service, knowledgable stuff. great wine selection. definitely recommended if you are near union square. try both the wine and cheese flights.
author: Jason L.

description: Finding this place was not easy for some reason.  It is in a hotel but you can't access it from the hotel.  Nor is the door on the corner, which is where it looks to be on Google maps.  There is a great selection of wine though and doesn't seem too hatefully priced for San Francisco in/near Union Square.  Great place to stop into if you are in Union Square.
author: Scott M.

description: Service was good and so was the wine. Environment was nice and quiet. A great place to meet up with friends after work on a weekday.
author: Maggie C.

description: Loved this place. Had amazing cheese and wine at noon on a Saturday. The staff are incredibly knowledgeable and it was so fun!
author: Scott W.

description: They have a unique selections of flights. Nice cheese platters as well.
author: Randall R.

description: It's very nice wine bar I thing it's good place to be for relax your self
author: Jason S.

description: I am surprised by the great reviews on here because it wasn't my experience at all. I was in San Francisco on vacation last week and we came across what seemed to be a great combination bar, cheese and chocolate paired with wine! Sounds great! I ordered the dessert wine flight paired with the nostalgia chocolate flight. The wine was absolutely terrible. I am a huge wine fan and I couldn't even bring myself to finish the small amount that my glasses had in them. The chocolates were mediocre at best. My boyfriend ordered a cheese and red wine flight. You would think that at a cheese bar they would be able to handle lots of cheese orders, however, we sat there staring at our wine for maybe a hour hour before his cheese finally came out. We saw several people come to the bar looking for their cheese and one table had to even cash out and leave before their cheese came. When ours finally arrived, they apologized for the delay and said there was a cheese rush. How could there possibly be a cheese "rush" at a cheese bar?? We left very disappointed.
author: Mandi R.
